Title: Data & Analytics Strategist
Description:
Omega CRM is a Merkle & Dentsu company, leader in development of Customer Experience services, with +20 years of experience in the use of Technology applied to Marketing and providing a unique Customer Relationship with mainly focus on Innovation is looking for a Data & Analytics Strategist


Responsibilities




Gains industry and market expertise by participating in various projects to provide clients with a "benchmark" perspective.
Possesses a comprehensive understanding of the Analytics sector and the industry, contributing to business objectives by developing new products and services aligned with client needs.
Analyzes, estimates, and develops proposals to support the commercial team.
Identifies when specialists from other service lines or knowledge areas are needed to enhance client advisory.
Implements mechanisms to identify and control commercial risks during the pre-sales phase.
Analyzes and interprets risks before project initiation and communicates them to Operations.
Directly engages in delivering services for highly complex and high-risk projects, in coordination with Operations.
Develops new methodologies within their field of responsibility to impact the work of others and improve area outcomes.
Evaluates implementation results against the proposed solution, assessing efficiency and customer satisfaction.


Acts as a role model for the team, managing their development as a People Lead:



Establishes and implements a communication strategy to clearly define team objectives.
Develops and manages talent within the team, leveraging tools to enhance people and organizational goals.
Conducts logical analyses, identifies issues, seeks and interprets relevant information to share and coordinate data within the team, and helps remove obstacles to progress.
Supports, encourages, and motivates team members to foster commitment to the organization and area objectives.
Listens to team members, gathers their professional and personal needs, and collaborates with HR to facilitate career development.
Participates in decision-making regarding professional development, evaluation, and team performance.

Qualifications & Skills

Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Business Administration, or a related field (or equivalent vocational training).
Strong foundation in platform development, organization, time management, conflict resolution, prioritization, methodologies, and English proficiency.
Extensive experience in business data collection, interpretation, and process optimization.
At least 5 years of experience in a similar role (Project Manager / Solution Architect).
Proficiency in software tools related to the core technologies of the implemented applications.
Collaboration with business units and technology teams to enhance services, environments, and customer experience.
Data Engineering & Cloud: Talend, Pentaho, Datorama, SQL, Python.
Analytics & BI: Tableau, Power BI, Salesforce CRM Analytics, Grafana.
Languages: English proficiency.

WHAT DO WE OFFER

Permanent contract.
Flexible Schedule. We make it easy. Balance your professional and personal life.
Certifications plan. Improve your skills and get the official certificate from our main partners.
Home Office. You decide and we support you.
Flexible retribution (public transport ticket, Ticket restaurtant, ‚Ä¶).
Health insurance.
OMEGA in action. Our commitment to a better society is not just an intention
Professional development: Evolve, grow and get where you want to go.

About us

Omega CRM, a Merkle Company, is a global digital company specialising in accelerating the Business Experience (BX) of our clients through customer-centric solutions, technology, and data ‚Äì all enhanced by AI.
Together with Merkle, we form the largest Customer Experience Management (CXM) agency in Spain, and as part of the dentsu group, we offer end-to-end solutions that integrate media, creativity, content, technology, and strategy to deliver real business impact.
With over 23 years of experience, a team of 580+ professionals from 24 nationalities, and 2,500+ certifications, Omega CRM is a recognised leader in the Salesforce ecosystem in Spain.
We operate across key industries including Retail, Healthcare, Pharma, Real Estate, Education, and Non-Profit, delivering omnichannel experiences in Customer Service, eCommerce, Marketing, and Analytics.
Client satisfaction is at our core (rating: 4.9/5), and we‚Äôve been recognised with awards such as Salesforce Partner of the Year FY23 and Most Innovative Project (Iberia).
At Omega CRM, we believe in growth through people ‚Äì guided by our values: #Talent, #Flexibility, #Commitment, and #Innovation. We grow #Together.

Title: Jr. Network Specialist
Description:
Junior Network Specialist

Under the general supervision of the Senior Network Specialist and within established policies, procedures and guidelines, the Network Specialist will be responsible for assisting with the wireless data communications including NPC Wi-Fi, cellular services, configuration and deployment of routers, switches, and firewalls, network patch management, firmware updates, network documentation and network monitoring of NPC‚Äôs multi-location network. The position requires strong technical, interpersonal, and both verbal and written.

This role will be part of the after-hours support rotation and support the IT infrastructure and the Helpdesk.




Niagara Parks offers a salary of $70,966.44 to $84,668.18 per annum (Pay Band 8) for this position as well as a comprehensive benefit and defined benefit pension plan.




Applications for this position will be accepted until August 12, 2025.




QUALIFICATIONS:

Successful completion of a post-secondary education in engineering, computer science or equivalent, coupled with relevant network and routing experience.
CompTIA A+, Network+ and Security+ certification or equivalent vendor certifications required; Aruba Certified Mobility Associate (ACMA) or Aruba Certified Mobility Professional (ACMP);
Minimum of two (2) years‚Äô direct experience configuring, deploying, installing network equipment (switches, routers, firewalls etc.) in a fast paced, complex, enterprise network) required
Two years‚Äô experience in network security required; strong conceptual understanding of networks and be experienced in creating and developing logical and physical network designs
Technical understanding including: Palo Alto firewalls, OSPF routing, routed VPNs, NAC‚Äôs, local area networks, cable plant management, and telephony (VoIP) networking
The following qualifications are considered to be an asset: Aruba Certified Mobility Expert (ACME) or Aruba Wireless Mesh Professional (AWMP) . experience in network security as it applies to PCI-DSS compliance; working knowledge of Juniper and HP/Aruba networking equipment,; experience with fiber optic networks




KEY ACTIVITIES:

Network Infrastructure

Provides continuous improvement to network security and PCI-DSS compliance.
Configures, deploys, maintains and upgrades of local and wide area networks including the NPC fiber network, MPLS and private connections, as well as Internet and firewall connections; implements and troubleshoots redundancy options for wireless and traditional site-to-site links.
Maintains network monitoring and documentation for all aspects of the network infrastructure.
Maintains pro-active NOC, intrusion detection, and Security and Incident Event Management (SIEM) monitoring and reporting.
Responsible for pinpointing and resolving network connectivity issues.
Responsible for maintaining all wiring, jacking, data closets, data centres and the full extended cable plant and wiring infrastructure including fibre and radio and ensures that the infrastructure meets Panduit certification; works with contractors on renovation and new construction to ensure that IT standards are met.
Provides operational and on-call rotation support as required in a twenty four seven work environment.
Ensures a high level of customer support through proactive problem ownership and management, and adherence to change management standards.




Tier 2 Support and Network Administration

Assists with problem tickets and support timely resolution and closure of incidents.
Assists with the administration and support of network gateways, web filtering, and other applications interfacing to the internet to ensure a secure and safe computing environment.
Ensures that documentation and knowledge bases are kept up-to-date and maintained as an effective tool for design, support and troubleshooting.




Performs Other Related Duties

As assigned.

  • Responsible for maintaining all wiring, jacking, data closets, data centres and the full extended cable plant and wiring infrastructure including fibre and radio and ensures that the infrastructure meets Panduit certification; works with contractors on renovation and new construction to ensure that IT standards are met.
  • Provides operational and on-call rotation support as required in a twenty four seven work environment.
  • Ensures a high level of customer support through proactive problem ownership and management, and adherence to change management standards.


Tier 2 Support and Network Administration

  • Assists with problem tickets and support timely resolution and closure of incidents.
  • Assists with the administration and support of network gateways, web filtering, and other applications interfacing to the internet to ensure a secure and safe computing environment.
  • Ensures that documentation and knowledge bases are kept up-to-date and maintained as an effective tool for design, support and troubleshooting.


Performs Other Related Duties

  • As assigned.

Title: Drivers - On Demand Service Greater Niagara Region
Description:
Voyago is seeking responsible and compassionate individuals to join our team of on demand drivers in the Greater Niagara Region! Including St Catharine's, Welland and Fort Erie.

Your Role

As an On Demand Service driver, you will take pride in playing a key role in ensuring the independence and mobility of our city's most vulnerable passengers. Your efforts will directly contribute to their ability to access essential services, appointments, and daily activities safely and comfortably. You will provide safe, reliable transportation, while delivering excellent customer service and assisting passengers with care and respect. You will perform basic vehicle inspections at the start of each shift to ensure the vehicle is in good working order, including checking tire pressure, brakes, lights, and other essential systems. The rate of pay for this position is $20.00 per hour.

The Perks:


Make a Difference: You'll have the rewarding opportunity to help individuals with all needs maintain their independence and access essential services
Job Stability: you are essential workers, ensuring that transportation needs are met for vulnerable populations, providing long-term job security
Training and Development: Voyago offers the opportunity to gain valuable skills through ongoing training, including customer service, vehicle safety, and emergency response
Competitive Pay and Benefits: Receive competitive wages, along with comprehensive benefits packages for full time employees, including health insurance, retirement plans, and paid time off
Build Relationships: Form meaningful connections with regular passengers, creating a positive impact on their daily lives
Experience a dynamic work environment working with the public and the people in your community, meeting new passengers‚Äîeach with their own unique, heartwarming stories to share. No two days are the same, and you'll build connections that make your work truly rewarding


Key Responsibilities


You are offering door-to-door customer service
You may be assisting passengers in boarding vehicles and maneuvering wheelchairs or other accessible devices.
You may be attaching securement belts and lifting portable assistive devices as needed
You will ensure the proper restraint and security of passengers, devices, and mobility aids if applicable
You are providing passengers with accurate information on fares, schedules and stops
You will maintain a safe and comfortable environment throughout the journey
You will communicate effectively and professionally with passengers and team members
You will adhere to all company policies, procedures, and safety standards
You will be providing WOW! customer service to all passengers at all times
You are comfortable with a fast paced physically demanding job (pushing wheelchairs with a maximum of 250lbs. Twisting, pulling, getting low to the ground to secure the wheelchairs)


Requirements

Your Profile


You are a safe driver with a clean driving record
You can obtain a clean criminal record search with vulnerable sector screening
You are a professional driver with a minimum full G class drivers license
You are able to work with individuals who may have special needs in a compassionate and patient manner
You are physically capable to lift and maneuver assistive devices if required
You have excellent communication skills both written and oral
Your prior experience in a similar role would be preferred
You are comfortable working around any type of service animal
You have a sound knowledge of the Greater Niagara region and surrounding area
Various shifts available: Monday to Saturday: morning/afternoon/evenings, as well as 'Open Report' drivers who will be scheduled for onsite shifts, to pick up and cover multiple driving shifts as needed


Your Location

By joining the Voyago Transdev Transit team you'll find:


We offer a competitive hourly pay
We offer on the job training and job shadowing
We offer free license upgrade if applicable
We provide opportunities for growth
Our full time comprehensive benefit package is available for full time drivers, working 30+ hours or more per week
Working in a unionized environment


Benefits

The Perks


We support the development, work-life balance and well-being of our employees
We build a supportive corporate culture that encourages diversity and enables our people to flourish
We enable our employees to have a positive social impact by deploying sustainable mobility solutions
We offer our employees opportunities to build their own experience within a local, global Group
We offer comprehensive benefits packages for full time employees with an Employee and Family Assistance Program, a great company perks program and an Employee Referral Bonus for all staff
We are an Award Winning company
As a subsidiary of Transdev, we provide opportunities for a rewarding career with a growing, global transportation provider
We focus on innovation and sustainable environmental initiatives


Voyago is committed to provide accommodation for individuals with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. Accommodations are available upon request of the internal or external applicant. If you require an accommodation due to a disability for an interview, please notify Human Resources directly to make appropriate arrangements when contacted for an interview.

We thank all applicants however only those under consideration will be contacted.

Title: Lab Technician
Description:
Oxy is an international energy company with assets primarily in the United States, the Middle East and North Africa. We are one of the largest oil and gas producers in the U.S., including a leading producer in the Permian and DJ basins, and offshore Gulf of Mexico. Our midstream and marketing segment provides flow assurance and maximizes the value of our oil and gas. Our chemical subsidiary OxyChem manufactures the building blocks for life-enhancing products. Our Oxy Low Carbon Ventures subsidiary is advancing leading-edge technologies and business solutions that economically grow our business while reducing emissions. We are committed to using our global leadership in carbon management to advance a lower-carbon world. Visit oxy.com for more information.

Occidental strives to attract and retain talented employees by investing in their professional development and providing rewarding opportunities for personal growth. Our goal is to meet the highest employer standards by ensuring the health and safety of our employees, protecting the environment and positively impacting our communities where we do business.

We are looking for an experienced and self-motivated individual to fill a Lab Tech position with our Chemical Plant located in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Responsibilities


Provides outside department coverage as required such as but not limited to: Traffic Coordinator, Administration, ISO 9001 quality system support etc.
Performs Lab Housekeeping.
Participates in Resin team meetings and on fire brigade.
Sets priorities for lab workload for the shift with input from the process Foreman and Technical Manager.
Assists Resin personnel in problem solving.
Provides on-call shift coverage for sick time or extra testing requirements of process units.


Qualifications


Successful completion of a Community College Diploma in Chemistry (or related Chemical Technology program) with relevant experience preferred OR completion of a High School diploma coupled with a minimum of 5 years of related laboratory experience in a PVC plant environment.
Must be able to work day / night rotating shifts, overtime, weekends and holidays as necessary. Hours of work will vary from week to week depending upon operational requirements, however the default hourly work schedule would be Monday - Friday, 40 hours / week.
Knowledge of Lab processes, procedures and related systems in a Lab environment.
Sound knowledge of the Occupational Health and Safety Act and regulations.
Knowledge of computer software applications, instrumentation and ability to operate computer systems and software applications including Microsoft Excel, Word, Power-point, Outlook, and to conduct research using the internet.
SAP knowledge / experience would be an asset.
Problem solving/analytical skills, strong organizational and coordination skills.
Ability to work independently and within a team is required.
Related Lab testing experience an asset.
Familiar with plant operations, computerized systems, processes and procedures.
Related experience in preparing reports and maintaining records.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills both written and verbal.
Ability to deal with tact, diplomacy and courtesy. In addition, must have previous experience with Health and Safety practices and procedures in a manufacturing environment, ideally a chemical processing facility.


Recruitment Fraud

It has come to our attention various individuals and/or organizations are contacting people falsely pretending to recruit on behalf of Oxy. Please be aware that these recruiting scams and communications do not originate nor are they associated with our recruitment process. All Oxy job postings and offers will require a completed application through our company website.

Oxy does not charge a fee at any stage of the recruiting process. We will never:


Ask you to pay for applications, interviews, meetings, processing, training or for any other fees
Use recruiting or placement agencies that charge candidates an advance fee of any kind or
Request personal information such as passport and bank account details at an early stage of our recruitment process.


We recommend against responding to unsolicited business propositions or offers from people you don't know. Do not disclose your personal or financial details. If you believe you have been the victim of a recruiting scam, please contact your local police department.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.

Title: Fashion Associate (Part time) - Outlet Collection
Description:
Company Description

At RW&CO., our mission is to create clothes for the style-savvy to feel empowered in, without sacrificing their individuality or personality. We believe every single outfit reveals possibility, and we share our community‚Äôs love for the confidence that our products, services, and expertise bring to their life, everywhere, every day. We strive to be a brand that is not only on-trend but also dedicated to our community ‚Äì which means all our products are made with care, passion, and with quality materials so they're built to last. Sounds like you? Become the ultimate‚ÄØRWInsider‚ÄØand start your‚ÄØRCL career‚ÄØtoday!

Job Description

Are you a lover of fashion? Do you stay current on trends? Do you enjoy engaging with customers? Then this role is for you!

As a Fashion Associate, you will focus on delivering an exceptional customer experience to every customer through your genuine ability to make our customers feel comfortable, cared for and confident.

A Day In The Life (What You Will Do)


Provide an amazing shopping experience that will encourage positive customer connections and loyalty
Perform register functions while using your sales, promotion and product knowledge to drive add-on sales
Cover the sales floor and help ensure all visual standards are met


Qualifications

Who you are (What you will bring):


Previous sales or customer service experience is an asset.
Ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment while also being committed to creating an amazing customer experience
Ability to work evenings and weekends.


Additional Information

What we offer (Why work with us):

Hiring rate of $17.95 (rate may be greater based on relevant experience)


A competitive benefits package (Full Time Employees Only)
Paid Time Off ( Sick Time, Flex Days & Vacation (Full Time Employees Only)
Additional benefits include monthly bonus potential, opportunities for advancement and tuition reimbursement
50% discount at all Reitmans (Canada) Limited brands (Reitmans, RW&CO. and PENN.)
Generous Employee Referral Policy


If this inspires you‚Ä¶let‚Äôs talk. Send us your resume today!

By the way, did you know that Reitmans (Canada) Limited hasover 400 stores all across Canada and three fashion apparel banners? Get ready to join the Canadian fashion retail icon, with a great success story where you can have a voice and make a real difference.

At RCL, opt for a job that suits you!

Reitmans (Canada) Limited is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodation needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for providing an accessible candidate experience.

We thank all applicants. Only selected candidates will be contacted.

Title: Client Advisor
Description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As an RBC Ambassador inside our branches, you will put clients first and find solutions to their individual needs. You will champion the RBC brand and drive business by supporting new client acquisition and deepening existing relationships. If you have the self-motivation to deliver exceptional customer service and are excited to help clients embrace our digital capabilities, you can build a great career with us as a future Account Manager/Banking Advisor.

What will you do?


Proactively engage with clients in the branch and deliver an outstanding service experience through completing transactions and by identifying opportunities for advice, solutions, digital enablement and partner introductions
Focus on education and demonstration, leverage technology to deliver a memorable client experience, drive solutions and retain business
Contribute to team results by listening and spotting opportunities to offer additional advice, introduce clients to the capability of RBC partners, or personally fulfil client solutions
Proactively take ownership of resolving and preventing client banking problems
Cultivate and maintain relationships with partners to work as one RBC team
Manage risks by adhering to compliance routines, processes, and controls to protect client and shareholder interests while completing transactions


What do you need to succeed?

Must-have


Goal-oriented individual with a demonstrated passion for putting clients first.
Drive and self-motivation, as well as excellent communication skills and emotional intelligence
Digital literacy across a broad range of devices (i.e., smartphones, tablets, laptops, etc.)
Personal flexibility to work flex hours
Eagerness to learn and determination to succeed
Confidence and ability to learn financial concepts and willingness to obtain the Investment Funds in Canada or the Canadian Securities Course


Nice-to-have


Track record in building rapport and maintaining client relationships within the financial, service or retail industry
Mutual Funds accreditation


Is this job right for you? Check out our video and decide for yourself!

What‚Äôs in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
A world-class training program in financial services
Excellent career development and access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team


Job Skills

Adaptability, Advice Based Solutions, Client Centricity, Client Discovery, Communication, Curiosity, Data Analysis, Digital Literacy

Additional Job Details

Address:

571 NIAGARA ST:WELLAND

City:

WELLAND

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

16

Employment Type:

Part time

Platform:

PERSONAL & COMMERCIAL BANKING

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2025-07-25

Application Deadline:

2025-08-08

Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the application deadline date above

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we believe an inclusive workplace that has diverse perspectives is core to our continued growth as one of the largest and most successful banks in the world. Maintaining a workplace where our employees feel supported to perform at their best, effectively collaborate, drive innovation, and grow professionally helps to bring our Purpose to life and create value for our clients and communities. RBC strives to deliver this through policies and programs intended to foster a workplace based on respect, belonging and opportunity for all.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at jobs.rbc.com</a/span>

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Commit Data is looking for a highly skilled Data Engineer to join our growing Data Analytics Department.

As a Data Engineer in a multi cloud company, you will build data-driven solutions for our customers using cutting-edge data tools and large-scale data on AWS\GCP\Azure.

Job Responsibilities:


Lead data solutions design and development for our various clients and projects.
Design the solution by understanding the needs, modeling the data, choosing the right tools and defining the interfaces/dashboards.
Develop Data Pipelines, Data Lakes, DWHs, AI\ML models, Dashboards and reports using advanced tools and leading technologies.


Requirements:

Requirements:


5+ years of relevant experience as Data Engineer ‚Äì a must.
Experience with Python based data pipelines/ETLs and other ETL\ELT tools (such as Glue, Rivery, Data Factory, DBT).
High Proficiency in SQL ‚Äì a must.
Experience designing and developing DWHs in the cloud ‚Äì Redshift\Snowflake\BigQuery is a must.
Experience with BI & visualizations tools like Tableau\Quicksight\Power BI\Looker.
Knowledge and experience with AI\ML (working with tools like SageMaker\ Bedrock\ Q\ BigQuery ML\ Vertex AI\ Gemini) - big advantage.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to details.
High self-learning skills
Fluent English

HTML:
Commit Data is looking for a highly skilled Data Engineer to join our growing Data Analytics Department.

As a Data Engineer in a multi cloud company, you will build data-driven solutions for our customers using cutting-edge data tools and large-scale data on AWS\GCP\Azure.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Lead data solutions design and development for our various clients and projects.
  • Design the solution by understanding the needs, modeling the data, choosing the right tools and defining the interfaces/dashboards.
  • Develop Data Pipelines, Data Lakes, DWHs, AI\ML models, Dashboards and reports using advanced tools and leading technologies.

Requirements:

Requirements:

  • 5+ years of relevant experience as Data Engineer ‚Äì a must.
  • Experience with Python based data pipelines/ETLs and other ETL\ELT tools (such as Glue, Rivery, Data Factory, DBT).
  • High Proficiency in SQL ‚Äì a must.
  • Experience designing and developing DWHs in the cloud ‚Äì Redshift\Snowflake\BigQuery is a must.
  • Experience with BI & visualizations tools like Tableau\Quicksight\Power BI\Looker.
  • Knowledge and experience with AI\ML (working with tools like SageMaker\ Bedrock\ Q\ BigQuery ML\ Vertex AI\ Gemini) - big advantage.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to details.
  • High self-learning skills
  • Fluent English

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Description:
Company Description

Wix makes it possible for anyone to succeed online. Since 2006, we‚Äôve grown to around 5,500 employees in 22 countries, launched over 40 products, and serve over 243 million users and their visitors worldwide. At Wix, we push you to innovate, evolve in non-traditional ways, and collaborate. We operate in small teams that work closely together at a high level.

Although we‚Äôre already industry leaders in web creation and business, our work is nowhere near done. Our goal is to become the main engine of the Internet so we can create a more open web for all.

Job Description

Join our Partners Data Team as a Senior Data Engineer and take on the challenge of designing, implementing, and maintaining critical data pipelines. You'll play a key role in ensuring data integrity and accessibility, enabling our teams to drive strategy and optimize partner experiences. In your day-to-day, you will:


Design and implement data pipelines, ensuring the seamless flow of information into our data warehouse
Develop scalable solutions to address data gaps and process design needs
Monitor data pipeline performance, troubleshoot issues, and guarantee data infrastructure availability
Collaborate with analysts and product managers to align data models with business priorities
Engage with a diverse group of stakeholders, including data engineers, analysts, and data scientists, to support data-driven decision-making



Qualifications


2+ years of experience as a Data Engineer, ideally within an online company handling large datasets
Proficient in SQL, with the ability to craft complex queries, and skilled in Python for developing data pipelines
Independent and quick learner with excellent prioritization skills and the ability to work collaboratively
Fluent in English with strong communication abilities
Familiarity with Airflow, Great Expectations, Spark, and cloud data solutions (Google or AWS) ‚Äì an advantage



Additional Information

The Partners Data Team is a blend of Data Engineers and Business/Data Analysts dedicated to shaping the strategy for Partners and Wix Studio. We delve deep into data to uncover growth opportunities, refine the partner journey, and elevate the partner experience on our Wix Studio platform. We seek a naturally curious individual eager to understand the mechanics and motivations behind the data.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Description:
Are you passionate about data-driven decision-making and product optimization? AutoDS, recently acquired by Fiverr, is looking for a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our team. This role offers the unique opportunity to operate independently under the AutoDS brand while benefiting from Fiverr's stability as a publicly traded company.




In this role, you will partner closely with the Product Team and CTO to analyze user behavior, monitor KPIs, and uncover actionable insights that drive user engagement and platform success. You‚Äôll be at the heart of our product‚Äôs growth, "living" every funnel, feature, and functionality. We'd love to hear from you if you're a collaborative, detail-oriented, and self-motivated professional with a strong business sense and technical expertise.




Responsibilities:

Act as the primary analysis partner for the Product Team, providing actionable insights and recommendations.
Conduct ad-hoc analyses to answer critical business questions.
Plan, execute, and analyze A/B tests to impact product decisions.
Monitor and analyze product-related KPIs, identifying trends and opportunities for optimization.
Develop dashboards and reports to give stakeholders visibility into platform health, user behavior, and key usage trends.
Implement new measurement systems to support data-driven decisions.
Deeply understand the product‚Äôs funnels, functionalities, and user journeys.
Collaborate closely with the CTO and Product Team to align analytics with strategic goals.




Requirements:

Must-Have Skills and Experience:

5 years of experience in a Data Analyst role.
Proficiency in SQL (MySQL experience preferred).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate data into clear and compelling insights.
Proven experience with A/B test methodologies, including planning, execution, and analysis.
Experience working alongside product teams and managers.
High level of spoken and written English.
Familiarity with product analytics tools.

Nice-to-Have Skills:

Advanced expertise in Mixpanel or equivalent tools.
Experience with Tableau or equivalent data visualization tools.

Soft Skills:

Collaborative team player with excellent communication skills.
Detail-oriented and highly organized.
Self-motivated and proactive in driving initiatives.
Strong business acumen and storytelling capabilities to present findings effectively.

Title: Business Data Analyst 492
Description:
You're invited to Join Beach Bum, the greatest gaming family that brings a new twist to classic games by introducing them to the world of casual online games




Responsibilities:

Conduct in-depth analysis of large-scale gameplay, monetization, and user behavior data to extract meaningful insights that support product and feature development.
Develop and execute complex SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data from diverse sources.
Collaborate effectively with product, monetization, and game economy managers to establish key performance indicators (KPIs) and thoroughly evaluate their performance.
Design and generate insightful dashboards and reports that effectively communicate findings and monitor critical metrics.
Support A/B testing initiatives by analyzing results and providing clear interpretations.
Present data-driven recommendations in a clear, concise, and actionable manner to stakeholders.




Requirements:

2+ years of proven experience as a Data Analyst.
Strong proficiency in SQL, with demonstrated ability to independently write and optimize complex queries.
Highly proficient Excel skills, including expertise in data manipulation, formula creation, and charting.
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics, or Engineering.
Exceptional analytical skills, meticulous attention to detail, and a commitment to data integrity.
A collaborative team player with strong written and verbal communication abilities.




Soft Skills:

Strategic Thinker: Ability to see the big picture and align tasks with broader business goals.
Proactive Problem-Solver: Independent and initiative-driven with a strong can-do attitude.
Attention to Detail: Systematic approach to tasks with exceptional accuracy.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Ramat Gan, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Description:
Overwolf is looking for a brave Data Engineer to help us build and maintain a robust analytics platform for internal and external purposes.

If you have an in-depth understanding of data modeling, exceptional analytical skills, and know how to cast powerful transformation spells - come join our adventure.

Responsibilities:

In this role, you will:


Be a critical part of our core analytics platform, helping to drive business value for both internal and external customers
Serve as a cross-organizational data expert and assist in cultivating a data-driven culture by empowering data exploration and accessibility
Design, develop, and maintain a cross-platform data infrastructure using cutting-edge technologies in a big data environment
Build scalable, reliable, and business-entity-centered data models and data marts
Develop robust and efficient data solutions, including DAGs, documentation, dimensions, facts, and aggregations
Champion data accuracy, quality, and validity across systems and processes
Wield a magical sword that glows blue near goblins, orcs, and bad data


Requirements:


Strong SQL experience (2+ years) in querying large and complex data sets
Proven hands-on experience (2+ years) in a cloud-based data warehouse, preferably Snowflake
Proficiency in data modeling (2+ years) specifically star schema methodology (dimensions, facts, profiles, etc.)
2+ years of experience of data ingestion, integration and wrangling in a Python-based environment
Bright and proactive; works well both independently and as part of a team, passionate about data
Hands-on experience with data workflow management platforms such as Airflow, Astronomer or Cloud Composer
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
BSc/BA in a highly quantitative field such as Industrial Engineering / Information Technology / Advanced Statistics background or equivalent academic knowledge


Bonus points:


True passion for gaming (PC / Console)
Hands-on Codeless ETL programming experience with Rivery / Fivetran (or equivalent)
Experienced in Docker architecture
Hands-on experience with Tableau (or equivalent) and the ability to communicate insights in a visual, slick manner
Can cast resurrection spells while in combat.

Title: Financial Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Company Description

About CyberArk:

CyberArk (NASDAQ: CYBR), is the global leader in Identity Security. Centered on privileged access management, CyberArk provides the most comprehensive security offering for any identity ‚Äì human or machine ‚Äì across business applications, distributed workforces, hybrid cloud workloads and throughout the DevOps lifecycle. The world‚Äôs leading organizations trust CyberArk to help secure their most critical assets. To learn more about CyberArk, visit our CyberArk blogs or follow us on X, LinkedIn or Facebook.

Job Description

As a Financial Data Analyst Intern, you will play a key role in delivering data-driven insights to support strategic and operational decisions across the organization. You will assist in building and maintaining data models, automating reporting processes, and performing detailed data analyses to uncover trends, anomalies, and opportunities for optimization.

This role provides hands-on exposure to financial data infrastructure and offers opportunities to work cross-functionally with Finance, GTM, R&D, Marketing, and other business units. Your work will contribute to enhanced performance measurement, strategic planning, and forecasting accuracy.

Responsibilities include:



Extracting, transforming, and analyzing data from multiple sources using SQL and Excel.
Building and maintaining dashboards and reports for internal stakeholders.
Supporting business teams with insights on financial and operational performance.
Collaborating on the development of KPIs and metrics that drive business efficiency and transparency.
Identifying patterns and trends in large data sets to support process improvement and decision-making.
Participating in automation initiatives to streamline recurring reporting processes.



Qualifications



Currently enrolled in a bachelor‚Äôs program in Finance, Economics, Data Analytics, Statistics, Business, or a related discipline with a strong analytical focus.
Solid proficiency in Excel, including pivot tables, VLOOKUP, SUMIFS, INDEX-MATCH, and charting tools.
Practical experience with SQL: writing queries, joining tables, filtering datasets.
Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in data handling.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
Availability to work 2.5 days a week.



How You Will Stand Out From the Crowd:



Demonstrated experience working with large and complex data sets.
Experience using BI/reporting tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, or similar).
Comfortable translating raw data into clear business insights and visualizations.
Proven ability to prioritize tasks and deliver high-quality results under tight deadlines.
A self-starter with curiosity and a proactive mindset toward solving problems through data.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A startup in the Gaming Hyper-Casual space offers a holistic advertising and marketing platform for apps. They define and target the app‚Äôs audience using social media, blogs, App Store optimizations, and more to create an exceptional user experience, increase active users, and grow revenue.




The company is well-funded with strong financial backing and was founded by a serial entrepreneur with multiple successful exits.




Located in Tel Aviv (near a train line), the company operates fully on-site with a team of about 30 employees.




Role Overview:

Part of a team reporting to the Team Lead.
Tech stack includes SQL and Tableau.




Requirements:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think creatively and uncover hidden trends in user data.
5+ years of experience in data analysis, with a strong focus on SQL and BI tools (Tableau preferred).
Proven experience working with user data, retention metrics, KPIs, and business insights.

Title: IT Administrator
Description:
Nanox Imaging is a dynamic and growing organization, specializes in imaging solutions for the healthcare industry and are expanding our global presence. We are revolutionizing medical imaging with cutting-edge technology that enhances patient care and drives innovation.

We are looking for a highly motivated IT Administrator to take a part of our mission and join the dynamic IT team. You will optimize our IT infrastructure, provide essential IT support to our global workforce, ensuring seamless operation of hardware, software, collaboration tools, and network infrastructure.

Responsibilities:


Helpdesk Support: Provide efficient technical support to end-users, troubleshoot IT issues, and manage ticketing platforms to resolution.
IT Administration: Manage and maintain WIN, MAC, and LINUX operating systems, ensuring system health, performance, and security.
Microsoft 365 Administration: Assist in managing the Office 365 environment
Cloud Infrastructure: Contribute to the management of Azure AAD, AWS, and cloud infrastructure security, following established security protocols.
Network Management: Participate in network administration, including firewall configuration, switch management, and VLAN implementation.
Security Incident Response: Collaborate with the security team as a first responder to security incidents, conducting initial investigations and implementing containment measures.
Cybersecurity Implementation: Support the implementation and management of SIEM/SOC and CNAPP solutions under the guidance of the CISO


Requirements:


3+ years hands-on experience in IT support and helpdesk software and remote support tools.
Hands-on experience with troubleshooting and supporting MacOS and Windows 10/11 devices- mandatory. (Experience in Linux- advantage)
Proficiency in Microsoft Office 365 suite and Intune device management- including Active Directory, Group Policy, SharePoint, Exchange, and Teams.
Familiar with cloud infrastructure (AWS and Azure preferred)
Foundational knowledge of network infrastructure (firewalls, switches, VLANs)
Exposure to cybersecurity best practices and incident response procedures.
Networks/Operating systems/Cyber security/cloud certifications
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Effective communication and interpersonal abilities.
Ability to learn independently and adapt to evolving technologies.
Show more

Title: IT Help Desk
Place: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Description:
Are you ready for your next professional challenge in the high-tech world?

Gett is seeking an experienced and motivated IT Help Desk Specialist to join our global IT team. In this role, you‚Äôll support over 400 employees, manage help desk tickets in a fast-paced environment, and contribute to the stability and efficiency of our internal IT operations.

If you're a tech-savvy professional with a passion for service, thrive in a hybrid Windows/Mac environment, and want to work with cutting-edge technologies in a dynamic, people-first company‚Äîthis opportunity is for you.

Responsibilities:


Provide hands-on technical support for hardware, software, systems, and services across the organization.
Respond to IT incidents and service requests via helpdesk tickets, phone, email, or in-person.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues in Windows and macOS environments.
Manage user accounts and permissions in Microsoft Azure Active Directory.
Set up and onboard new employees, including hardware provisioning and system access.
Maintain IT asset inventory and ensure hardware/software is up to date.
Support MDM platforms (e.g., Intune, Jamf) and enforce security policies.
Assist in maintaining network infrastructure including Wi-Fi, switches, and firewalls.
Escalate complex technical issues and follow through until resolution.
Document technical procedures, solutions, and user interactions.
Deliver excellent customer service and maintain a high level of user satisfaction.
Be available for on-call support approximately once every three weeks, as part of the team‚Äôs shared responsibility for critical issues.


Requirements:

Requirements:


4+ years of hands-on experience in IT support within mid-to-large scale environments (400+ users).
Deep knowledge of Microsoft Azure AD, including user management, permissions, roles, and group policies.
Strong experience with Windows and macOS operating systems.
Proficiency with MDM platforms such as Intune, Jamf, or similar.
Solid understanding of Google Workspace and Microsoft 365 administration.
Familiarity with basic networking concepts (e.g. firewalls, switches, routing, Wi-Fi).
Experience working with AI-based tools or platforms (e.g. AI assistants, automation bots, AI monitoring tools) ‚Äì a strong advantage.
Scripting or automation knowledge (e.g. Python) ‚Äì an advantage.
Exceptional troubleshooting and multitasking skills with a proactive mindset.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills ‚Äì both written and verbal.
Able to work independently, prioritize effectively, and remain calm under pressure.
Relevant IT certifications (e.g. CompTIA, Microsoft, Apple, Cisco) ‚Äì a plus.
Fluent English ‚Äì verbal and written proficiency is mandatory.


At Gett, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive, respectful environment where everyone feels valued and empowered to succeed. We believe that diversity drives innovation, and we‚Äôre proud to offer equal opportunities to all‚Äîregardless of age, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other characteristic. If you need accommodations during the recruitment process, please contact us at recruitment.il@gett.com ,and we‚Äôll do our best to support you. Click here to view our privacy policy.

o At least 3 years of experience in analyzing BI systems - writing business and technical specification documents

o Good knowledge of SQL - mandatory

o Knowledge in the insurance field (elementary) - mandatory

o Energetic, independent, big-headed

o Ability to work on several issues simultaneously

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Accelerate Your Career in Cybersecurity!

Join Pentera and take your career to the next level in cybersecurity. As a leader in Automated Security Validation, we help businesses around the world safely emulate real-world attacks to uncover their vulnerabilities‚Äîjust like the world‚Äôs best red teams. At Pentera, you‚Äôll be at the forefront of cybersecurity innovation, working on advanced tools that challenge organizations' defenses and push the limits of security testing.

With over 350 team members and 1,000+ customers in more than 50 countries, Pentera is a growing company supported by top investors like Insight Partners, K1, and The Blackstone Group.

If you're looking to grow your skills, make a difference, and be part of an innovative team, Pentera is the place for you.

About the role:

We‚Äôre looking for a strategic and detail-oriented Business Analyst to drive impact across our post-sales teams -including Customer Success, Technical Advisors, Support, and Customer Marketing. In this role, you‚Äôll play a critical part in shaping and executing our data strategy, providing actionable insights and optimizing key processes.

You will have the opportunity to influence business decisions through data and help scale our customer-facing operations. This is a high-impact role where your work will directly support smarter, data-driven decision-making across the organization

Responsibilities:


Act as the go-to resource for customer data insights and process improvements across teams
Proactively Identify trends, performance gaps, and activity patterns to inform leadership decisions
Support revenue growth by analyzing key business metrics (e.g., Renewal Rate,NRR, GRR, adoption, risk, usage)
Develop and maintain business review cadences including sales forecasts, quarterly business reviews, board meetings and other leadership initiatives
Enhance data usability through tools like Salesforce, Gainsight, Gong using automation and workflow optimization
Ensure data accuracy, implement audit processes and establish standards to achieve impeccable Salesforce data hygiene
Leverage AI-powered tools and predictive analytics to drive smarter decision-making, automate reporting, identify customer trends / risk signals proactively


Requirements:


3+ years of experience as a Business Analyst / Revenue Operations Analyst / Financial Planning Analyst or a similar role at a rapidly scaling organization - in the SaaS industry
Solid experience with Salesforce CRM and Excel /Google Sheets, including analyzing complex data sets- A Must
Ability to tell the story and present the results in a clear and concise manner
Fluent in English & comfortable communicating with stakeholders around the globe
Advanced analytical skills, data modeling, business insight with the ability to build clear and concise models and presentations
Team player, self-motivated, detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently


We look forward to getting to know you!

We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to building a diverse and talented workforce. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other class or characteristic protected by applicable law. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds to join us!

Title: Business Applications Analyst
Description:
Accelerate Your Career in Cybersecurity!

Join Pentera and take your career to the next level in cybersecurity. As a leader in Automated Security Validation, we help businesses around the world safely emulate real-world attacks to uncover their vulnerabilities‚Äîjust like the world‚Äôs best red teams. At Pentera, you‚Äôll be at the forefront of cybersecurity innovation, working on advanced tools that challenge organizations' defenses and push the limits of security testing.

With over 350 team members and 1,100+ customers in more than 50 countries, Pentera is a growing company supported by top investors like Insight Partners, K1, and The Blackstone Group. If you're looking to grow your skills, make a difference, and be part of an innovative team, Pentera is the place for you!

We are looking for a Business Applications Analyst to join our Global Business Applications Team at Pentera. In this role you will be delivering an improved user experience, increasing productivity and efficiency across Pentera‚Äôs various Business Units.

Job Description

The Business Applications Analyst will be part of a team that owns, develops, and executes the day-to-day configuration, support, maintenance and overall improvement of Pentera‚Äôs instance of Salesforce and other related applications. In this role, you will configure and operate Pentera‚Äôs business applications while working closely with different business units including Sales, Marketing, SDR, Customer Success, Finance, Legal and more.

Responsibilities


Lead Salesforce projects end-to-end: characterize business needs, design and develop new processes and implement them in Salesforce and other business applications
Support integrations with external systems e.g. Dealhub, Allbound, Funnelsource, ClientSuccess, Hubspot, Docusign, Outreach, PRM and more
Provide ongoing technical support including system configuration & maintenance
Monitor the efficiency of the system and introduce ways to improve it
Establish best practices and drive adoption of new workflows and processes
Analyze business questions and identify growth opportunities
Be responsible for data integrity and meta-data maintenance
Document processes, workflows and best practices in Pentera‚Äôs knowledge base


Requirements:


3+ years of hands-on Salesforce admin experience working on medium and larger projects
At least 1 year experience in Saas company
Excellent knowledge of Salesforce, with the ability to build custom apps and objects, formulas, flows,validations,approval flows & etc
Experience working with outsourced developers
Strong quantitative capabilities with a passion for numbers and analytics
Curiosity and skills to debug and get to the bottom of a problem and help resolve it with a solid long-term solution
Ability to manage multiple projects end-to-end
Strong relationship-building and communication skills in English


Advantage:


Salesforce.com Certified
Dealhub experience
Experience with SQL and BI tools (Looker/Tableau/similar)
Experience writing code


We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to building a diverse and talented workforce. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other class or characteristic protected by applicable law. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds to join us!

  • Document processes, workflows and best practices in Pentera‚Äôs knowledge base

Requirements:

  • 3+ years of hands-on Salesforce admin experience working on medium and larger projects
  • At least 1 year experience in Saas company
  • Excellent knowledge of Salesforce, with the ability to build custom apps and objects, formulas, flows,validations,approval flows & etc
  • Experience working with outsourced developers
  • Strong quantitative capabilities with a passion for numbers and analytics
  • Curiosity and skills to debug and get to the bottom of a problem and help resolve it with a solid long-term solution
  • Ability to manage multiple projects end-to-end
  • Strong relationship-building and communication skills in English

Advantage:

  • Salesforce.com Certified
  • Dealhub experience
  • Experience with SQL and BI tools (Looker/Tableau/similar)
  • Experience writing code

We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to building a diverse and talented workforce. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other class or characteristic protected by applicable law. We welcome candidates from all backgrounds to join us!

Title: BI Developer
Place: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Description:
We‚Äôre growing and looking to hire a BI Developer¬†who embodies our core values: People First, Customer Obsession, Striving for Excellence, and Integrity.

About Claroty:¬†¬†¬†

Claroty is on a mission to secure cyber-physical systems across industrial, healthcare, commercial and public sector environments: the Extended Internet of Things (XIoT). The Claroty Platform integrates with customers‚Äô existing infrastructure to provide a full range of controls for visibility, exposure management, network protection, threat detection, and secure access. Our solutions are deployed by over 1,000 organizations at thousands of sites across all seven continents.

Claroty is headquartered in New York City, with employees across the Americas, Europe, Asia-Pacific, and Tel Aviv. The company is widely recognized as the industry leader in cyber-physical systems protection, with backing from the world‚Äôs largest investment firms and industrial automation vendors, as well as recognition from KLAS Research as Best in KLAS for Healthcare IoT Security, the Deloitte Technology Fast 500, the Forbes Cloud 100, and the Fortune Cyber 60.¬†

About the Role:

We‚Äôre looking for a curious, detail-oriented, and hands-on BI Engineer to join our growing Business Applications team. In this role, you will lead Business intelligence initiative, maintain and develop the company Datawarehouse to support data-driven decisions across the company.

You‚Äôll play a key role in developing our BI infrastructure, working with tools such as Databricks, Rivery, Tableau, through collaborating closely with stakeholders from Finance, Customer Services, and Business Operations. If you're excited about translating business needs into scalable data solutions and being the go-to person for everything BI ‚Äì this one‚Äôs for you.





Responsibilities:




Build and maintain end-to-end BI solutions ‚Äì from data extraction and modeling to dashboard creation and insights delivery
Own and develop reports and dashboards in Tableau (and other BI tools)
Partner with cross-functional teams to understand reporting needs and translate them into effective data solutions
Design and implement efficient ETL processes
Manage data pipelines and contribute to the organization‚Äôs data lake/warehouse architecture
Support and maintain high-quality, consistent, and reliable datasets
Document data models, dashboards, and processes
Drive a data-first mindset across departments by making data accessible, visual, and actionable

Title: Data & Business Insights Developer
Place: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Description:
Why Join Us?

Check Point Harmony SASE is a leader in VPN and network security, innovating how businesses operate in today‚Äôs cloud-first, remote-work era. Our integrated platform delivers comprehensive protection at both the cloud and device level, serving a diverse and expanding customer base of over 3,000 businesses worldwide.

As a Data & Business Insights Developer, you‚Äôll collaborate with a dynamic development group focused on building next-generation SASE solutions. Your work will emphasize data analytics, business intelligence, and security, directly influencing thousands of organizations by empowering data-driven decision-making and delivering impactful, high-quality products.

If you are passionate about transforming data into actionable insights and want to shape the future of cloud security, we invite you to apply and make an impact with Check Point Harmony SASE.

Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain robust data models, databases, reports, and dashboards to provide actionable business insights.
Collect, analyze, and interpret large, complex datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.
Create, optimize, and enhance data visualizations and models to facilitate clear and effective decision-making.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver tailored data solutions.
Identify anomalies and propose solutions to drive the continuous improvement of our products and business processes.
Ensure the accuracy, integrity, security, and privacy of all data managed and processed.


Qualifications


At least 3 years of experience as a software developer, demonstrating proficiency in high-level programming languages (e.g., C#, Java, Swift, Python, or similar).
3+ years of hands-on experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field.
Advanced proficiency in SQL and contemporary data visualization tools (such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker).
Experience with cloud-based data platforms, preferably AWS or Azure.
Exceptional problem-solving skills and meticulous attention to detail.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights clearly and concisely to varied audiences.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or equivalent practical experience.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Data Engineer with solid experience building and maintaining large-scale data pipelines in the cloud.

You‚Äôll be joining a collaborative R&D team working on cutting-edge SaaS products, with full ownership over data workflows, architecture and performance.




What we‚Äôre looking for:

2‚Äì3 years of experience in data engineering roles

Hands-on experience with Azure cloud services, especially Data Factory, Data Lake, and Databricks

Solid knowledge of Databricks, including Spark-based processing, notebook orchestration, and ML pipeline integration

You‚Äôll work closely with data scientists, engineers and product teams to build data-driven features, enable experimentation at scale, and make sure pipelines are resilient and production-ready.

If you enjoy combining engineering with real-world impact ‚Äì let‚Äôs talk.

Title: Technical Support Engineer
Place: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Description:
Blockaid is redefining trust in blockchain through advanced, integrated security. Our on-chain security platform is trusted by leading Web3 companies‚Äîincluding Coinbase, MetaMask, Uniswap, Backpack, Stellar, and others‚Äîto detect, understand, and automatically prevent or minimize the impact of fraud, scams, hacks, and financial threats.

We are backed by top-tier global investors including Sequoia Capital, Ribbit Capital, and Cyberstarts‚Äîfirms known for supporting the most innovative and influential companies in technology and cybersecurity.

As the Technical Support L2 Engineer, based in Tel Aviv, you will have the unique opportunity to build and scale Blockaid‚Äôs L2 support function from the ground up and be a part of the Blockchain security future . Reporting to the Head of Customer Support, you will help our customers with their most pressing issues, protecting end-users from being scammed, creating real impact.

This role is meant for a true builder. As the first hire, you‚Äôll be a major player in building the support process for cutting edge new Blockchain security products, becoming subject matter expert and trusted advisor for Blockaid customers, engaging directly with our engineering and product team, and learning our product directly from them.

What You‚Äôll Do -


Provide expert-level technical support for Blockaid applications, diagnosing and resolving complex issues with aggressive resolution times.
Analyze sophisticated problems related to system performance, configuration issues, API integrations, Web3 security threats, and blockchain-related incidents.
Monitor system performance metrics, API health, and security incident alerts.
Serve as the primary point of contact for escalated customer issues, maintaining clear communication with stakeholders.
Coordinate with Engineering, Product Management, and Field Services teams to resolve complex technical challenges.
Identify opportunities for the support team to take on additional responsibilities and develop subject matter expertise.
Create and maintain comprehensive playbooks, troubleshooting guides, and internal documentation.
Develop tools and automation to improve support efficiency and reduce resolution time.
Maintain strict compliance with security policies and procedures, particularly when handling sensitive customer data.


Requirements:


3+ years of experience in an L1/2 support role.
Solid knowledge of databases, query optimization, and dashboard creation using Snowflake, SQL, and data visualization tools
Strong understanding of cybersecurity concepts, threat detection, incident response, and security best practices in Web3 environments
Working knowledge of networking concepts, including TCP/IP, DNS, VLANs, VPNs, and network troubleshooting methodologies
Proven troubleshooting abilities, analytical thinking, and systematic problem-solving approach for complex technical issues
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for technical documentation, customer interactions, and cross-team collaboration


Why Join Us -


Meaningful Work - We protect people from scams and financial harm ‚Äî our work truly matters. Every support interaction directly helps to safeguard users and build trust in the crypto ecosystem.
Elite Team - You‚Äôll work with some of the best minds in Web3 security and customer success. We pride ourselves on a culture of excellence, collaboration, and continuous learning.
True Ownership - You‚Äôll have the autonomy to lead and shape what world-class customer support looks like at Blockaid. This is a build-from-scratch role where your ideas will drive real change.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
AllCloud is a global professional services company that provides organizations with cloud enablement and transformation tools. As an AWS Premier Consulting Partner and audited MSP, a Salesforce Platinum Partner, and a Snowflake Premier Partner, AllCloud helps clients connect their front and back offices by building a new operating model to harness the benefits of cloud technology, data, and analytics.




AllCloud is looking for a savvy Data Engineer to join our growing team of data experts. The hire will be responsible for migrating to the cloud, optimizing our customers‚Äô databases and data flows, and enriching our operational and functional data flows with AI/ML algorithms.




The ideal candidate is not afraid of data in any form or scale, and is experienced with cloud services to ingest, stream, store, and manipulate data. The Data Engineer will support new system designs and migrate existing ones, working closely with solutions architects, project managers, and data scientists. The candidate must be self-directed, a fast learner, and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems, and products. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or re-designing our customers‚Äô data architecture to support their next generation of products, data initiatives, and machine learning systems.




Summary of Key Responsibilities

To meet compliance and regulatory requirements, keep our customers‚Äô data separated and secure.
Design, Build, and operate the infrastructure required for optimal data extraction, transformation, and loading from a wide variety of data sources using SQL, cloud migration tools, and ‚Äòbig data‚Äô technologies.
Optimize various RDBMS engines in the cloud and solve customers' security, performance, and operational problems.
Design, build, and operate large, complex data lakes that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
Optimize various data types' ingestion, storage, processing, and retrieval, from near real-time events and IoT to unstructured data such as images, audio, video, documents, and in between.
Work with customers' and internal stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data, Software Development and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure and business needs.




Requirements

2+ years of experience in a Data Engineer role in a cloud native ecosystem.
Bachelor's (Graduate preferred) degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.
Working experience with the following technologies/tools:
big data tools: Spark, ElasticSearch, Kafka, Kinesis etc.
Relational SQL and NoSQL databases, such as MySQL or Postgres and DynamoDB or Cassandra.
AWS Cloud data services.
Functional and scripting languages: Python, Java, Scala, etc.
Advanced SQL
Experience building and optimizing ‚Äòbig data‚Äô pipelines, architectures and data sets.
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‚Äòbig data‚Äô stores.
Experience supporting and working with external customers in a dynamic environment.
Articulate with great communication and presentation skills
Team player who can train as well as learn from others.
Fluency in Hebrew and English is essential




Why work for us?

Our team inspires progress in each other and in our customers through our relentless pursuit of excellence; you will work with leaders who promote learning and personal development. We offer competitive salaries, bonus incentives, benefits, flexible hours, and mentoring. Apply now to become part of the team.




AllCloud is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, provincial, or local law.

Show more

Title: Technical Support Engineer
Place: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Description:
About Oligo

Oligo is a rapidly growing startup headquartered in Tel Aviv, leading the way in reshaping Application Security. With a strong investment from top-tier VCs including Greenfield Partners, Red Dot Capital Partners, Lightspeed, Ballistic Ventures, and TLV Partners, we are developing a unique solution to address application security challenges, mainly focusing on open-source components in the application.

Our innovative technology leverages runtime application context while maintaining exceptional performance and stability. The Oligo Application Defense Platform gives security teams powerful capabilities to observe application components, detect intrusions, and mitigate threats, ensuring attacks are stopped before they can cause harm.

Role Overview

We are looking for a Technical Support Engineer to join our growing support team. This role is ideal for someone who is passionate about solving problems, learning new technologies, and helping customers succeed.

You will be part of a rapidly growing global support group that is still small and agile, offering a unique opportunity to make a real impact and grow with the team. We are a company working with cutting-edge cloud-native technologies, and this role will give you the opportunity supporting complex, modern infrastructure.

This is a role, focused on handling complex technical issues, driving product improvements, and serving as a critical link between our customers, R&D, and Customer Success teams. You will work on advanced troubleshooting, take ownership of high-impact problems, and help shape our support operations as we scale.

Responsibilities


Act as a senior escalation point for complex technical issues that require in-depth investigation and collaboration with R&D
Own the resolution of all support cases from investigation to closure, ensuring high customer satisfaction
Partner with Product and Engineering teams to identify and escalate recurring issues and serviceability gaps
Lead root cause analysis and proactively contribute to product improvements and knowledge sharing
Participate in on-call rotation for after-hours, holiday, and weekend support coverage
Create and maintain internal tools, scripts, and documentation to improve troubleshooting and operational efficiency
Work directly with customers to support deployment, configuration, and optimization of our platform in complex environments


Requirements:

Required Qualifications


3-4 years of experience in a Global technical support, or similar customer-facing technical role
Hands on experience using SQL to query databases and troubleshoot issues.
Proficiency with command-line tools and Linux operating system environments
Experience supporting cloud-native applications, including knowledge of Kubernetes and Helm
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, with a strong customer-first mindset.
Ability to work collaboratively and manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
Experience with writing technical documentation (FAQs, troubleshooting guides)
Familiarity with REST APIs and/or GraphQL for troubleshooting integrations and product behavior
Programming skills (Python, Java, etc.) ‚Äì an advantage

About Oligo

With a strong investment from top-tier VCs including Greenfield Partners, Red Dot Capital Partners, Lightspeed, Ballistic Ventures, and TLV Partners, we are developing a unique solution to address application security challenges, mainly focusing on open-source components in the application.

Title: BI / Data Science JB-4444
Description:
An international and innovative iGaming company is seeking an experienced BI/Data Science professional to join its data-driven team. The company specializes in transforming raw data into actionable insights using advanced analytics and business intelligence platforms, all within a supportive and cutting-edge tech environment.

The Opportunity:

We are looking for a skilled and experienced BI/Data Science expert to take a key role in building and optimizing the data layer that supports strategic decision-making across the company.




‚Ä¢ At least 5 years of hands-on experience in Data Science and ETL development

‚Ä¢ Advanced knowledge of SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services), including use of ZappySys components for API-based integrations, especially Salesforce

‚Ä¢ Strong proficiency in MS SQL (data modeling, query optimization) and Python for ETL, scripting, and automation

‚Ä¢ Solid experience integrating various cloud and SaaS platforms using REST/JSON APIs, particularly Salesforce and Tableau

‚Ä¢ Background working with iGaming data such as player behavior modeling, bonus optimization, fraud detection, churn prediction, and game analytics

Title: Cyber & Data Analyst XDR/NDR Detections
Place: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Description:
Why Join Us?

We‚Äôre looking for a Cyber & Data Analyst with a hacker‚Äôs curiosity and a data scientist‚Äôs precision, ready to craft high-fidelity detections and AI-powered insights. You‚Äôll be diving into huge log datasets in Azure (ADX), designing custom detection algorithms, and experimenting with advanced statistical models and AI techniques to detect hidden patterns and anomalies. This is a hands-on, impact-driven role where cyber expertise meets big data.

Key Responsibilities


Research, design, and deploy next-gen XDR and NDR detection rules across massive cybersecurity log datasets.
Hunt for unknown threats by analyzing attacker TTPs, malware behaviors, and building proactive detections.
Dive into large-scale data lakes to uncover anomalies, trends, and new detection opportunities, turning raw data into actionable algorithms.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to build content-driven security features that raise the bar for detection quality.
Experiment with new AI models and advanced analytics to shape the future of cyber detection.


Qualifications


4‚Äì7 years of experience in cybersecurity analysis, advanced threat detection, or data-driven cyber research (XDR/NDR experience is a strong plus).
Data-driven ‚Äì proven expertise in data analysis and algorithm development, including applying statistical and analytical methods to massive log datasets.
Solid grasp of AI/ML fundamentals, with real-world applications in anomaly detection, log enrichment, or behavioral modeling.
Fluent in Azure Data Explorer (ADX) and KQL, with a track record of building complex, high-performance queries over large-scale telemetry.
Advanced Python skills, including automation, tool development, and data pipelines.
Deep understanding of attacker tactics (MITRE ATT&CK), modern adversary tradecraft, and network protocols (TCP/IP, DNS, HTTP).
Hands-on experience with endpoint event analysis and data correlation techniques.
Proven ability to take end-to-end research projects from concept to operational, production-ready detection content.
