Title: Counter-Terrorism Researcher
Place: Ramat Gan, Tel Aviv District, Israel
Description:
ActiveFence is seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Senior Counter-Terrorism Researcher to join our Counter-Terrorism team. In this role, you will lead efforts to identify and analyze terror-related threats and narratives online, conducting advanced OSINT and WEBINT investigations and delivering in-depth, client-ready intelligence reports that support global Trust & Safety operations.

As a senior team member, you will be responsible for overseeing and refining the work of other team members, ensuring clarity, accuracy, and consistency across all outputs. You will also manage complex research projects from scoping to delivery, coordinating across internal teams and tools, and serving as a key point of contact for client-facing engagements. If you are an experienced intelligence professional with strong analytical skills, fluent Arabic, and a drive to lead impactful research, we encourage you to apply.

Responsibilities


Lead research efforts on terrorism-related content and activity online using OSINT and WEBINT methodologies.
Produce high-quality, actionable intelligence reports for clients, maintaining clarity, accuracy, and depth.
Review, edit, and synthesize multiple reports from other analysts into unified and coherent outputs.
Monitor online spaces for trends, emerging threats, and terror-related developments.
Collaborate with internal teams and contribute expert analysis to cross-functional initiatives.
Maintain a high level of organization and meet deadlines in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.


Requirements:


Native or near-native Arabic proficiency, with proven ability to conduct professional, research-level analysis and write in Arabic. MUST
At least 3‚Äì4 years of proven experience in intelligence, online investigations, or related fields. MUST
This role requires substantial experience conducting in-depth research and/or writing actionable intelligence reports for decision-makers.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, with a structured approach to research and problem-solving.
Native or fluent Arabic, with professional proficiency in reading, writing, and conducting research.
Demonstrated expertise in OSINT and/or WEBINT methodologies.
Experience producing detailed, high-quality intelligence reports.
Excellent communication skills and a strong team player.
Exceptional attention to detail, with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks effectively.
Proactive, self-driven, and able to perform well under pressure.


About ActiveFence:

ActiveFence is the leading provider of security and safety solutions for online experiences, safeguarding more than 3 billion users, top foundation models, and the world‚Äôs largest enterprises and tech platforms every day. As a trusted ally to major technology firms and Fortune 500 brands that build user-generated and GenAI products, ActiveFence empowers security, AI, and policy teams with low-latency Real-Time Guardrails and a continuous Red Teaming program that pressure-tests systems with adversarial prompts and emerging threat techniques. Powered by deep threat intelligence, unmatched harmful-content detection, and coverage of 117+ languages, ActiveFence enables organizations to deliver engaging and trustworthy experiences at global scale while operating safely and responsibly across all threat landscapes.

Title: Plant Utility
Description:
Job Description

Plant Utility

Location Port Colborne, Ontario

Position Type Operations

Salary Full-Time, Hourly

Compensation $25.71/hr ‚Äì This position offers a complete benefit package, retirement, health, life, vision and dental insurance

Pre-employment Requirement Successful completion of pre-employment medical and reference check

About ADM

For more than a century, the people of Archer Daniels Midland Company (NYSE: ADM) have transformed crops into products that serve vital needs of a growing world. Today we are one of the world‚Äôs largest agricultural processors and food ingredient providers, with approximately 40,000 employees serving customers in hundreds of countries. With a global value chain that includes approximately 450 crop procurement locations, more than 330 food and feed ingredient manufacturing facilities, 62 innovation centers and the world‚Äôs premier crop transportation network, we connect the harvest to the home, making products for food, animal feed, industrial and energy uses. For more information about ADM and its products, visit www.adm.com .

About The Position

Full time Utility ‚Äì this is an entry level position in a large flour milling plant in Port Colborne, Ontario. In order to meet the requirements of this job posting, the applicant will be cross-trained in operational positions to facilitate operational needs.

Responsibilities

Duties and Responsibilities


Training will be provided, and the successful candidate will be able to meet expectations within a reasonable period of time
Keeping safety a top priority in everything you do
Ensure all paperwork is filled out in a clear, legible and accurate format and completed with all required information
Monitor, operate, maintain, calibrate, and troubleshoot equipment
Duties include but are not limited to, material handling and light maintenance
Adhering to Safety Rules, GMP, HACCP, and Food Safety protocols is crucial
This position also includes general sanitation duties following established GMP‚Äôs for our food safety programs
Attend and practice all required health & safety and quality & food safety training
All other duties required


Required Skills And Qualifications


Must be able to work from heights, stand, sit, kneel, crawl, and bend
May be required to lift 55 lbs. / 22 kg
Must be able to work in a variety of hot, cold, or wet conditions
Shift work, overtime, and weekends will be required
The successful candidate must possess good communication skills, the ability to follow directions, and most importantly perform various tasks safely and independently in a production environment.
The successful applicant will be competent when working with machinery, including the ability to safely troubleshoot operational issues
Basic computer skills, numeracy and record accuracy are also necessary to succeed at this role.


Education Or Work Experience


High school education or equivalent is preferred.
Experienced in working in a Plant setting.


Additional Information


Work in accordance with local/provincial legislation
Understands and is accountable for full compliance with safety and other EHS requirements
There is room for further advancement in this role


This is a unionized work environment and you will be subject to the articles outlined in the current collective agreement once a suitable probationary period is fulfilled.

If you love the challenge of this dynamic career, then ADM will support and encourage your professional development and success. We are an equal opportunity employer who values diversity in the workplace. If you require accommodation during the hiring process, please advise us in advance so that we can make the reasonable accommodation.

If you're excited about this role, but do not meet all of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply anyway. We review all applications and still may consider you the right person for the role or have another open position where you‚Äôre the perfect fit. For more information, please see our website www.adm.com .

Title: Reliability Engineer - E&I
Description:
Syensqo is all about chemistry. We‚Äôre not just referring to chemical reactions here, but also to the magic that occurs when the brightest minds get to work together. This is where our true strength lies. In you. In your future colleagues and in all your differences. And of course, in your ideas to improve lives while preserving our planet‚Äôs beauty for the generations to come.
We are looking for:
An experienced Reliability Engineer E&I who will be accountable for sites Reliability program with focus on early detection of defects and defect elimination. This Reliability Engineer will be accountable for asset performance in relation to sites‚Äô Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE) program and have knowledge of continuous improvement methodologies, financial resources, tools, and reports. This individual will have the ability to manage and direct capital projects, have knowledge of information systems and CMMS and experience with different types of transmitters and control valves
We can count on you to:

Support Maintenance team on repair planning for critical equipment failures
Active involvement in site OEE program and maintaining equipment Bad Actors List
Facilitate and participate in reliability related improvement initiatives
Conduct root cause failure analysis on major equipment failures and manage improvement action items
Perform equipment criticality analysis and ensure adequate spare parts for all critical assets
Design preventative/predictive/condition based monitoring program for critical assets
Interpret reliability data and provide guidance on failure mitigation/reliability improvement plans
Actively engage in capital projects to ensure proper equipment selection and installation
Execute projects related to equipment or process changes for improved asset reliability
Assist with the design and management of sites Mechanical Integrity program
Key member in the development and execution of the shutdown timelines. Ensures that all critical reliability tasks are performed during the shutdowns.


You can count on us for:

We offer the opportunity to join an exciting growth company
A full range of benefits as expected of a successful company
Opportunities for growth and learning
Encouraging a diverse and inclusive workplace culture that values and respects individual differences and backgrounds
Long-lasting excellent customer relations, self-dependent working, and a variety of tasks in one of the world‚Äôs leading chemical companies.


You will bring:

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Electrical or Instrumentation
8 years of Chemical plant or similar industry experience preferred
Excellent analytical skills
Excellent communication skills and detail oriented
Ability to manage multiple priorities
Experience with formalized Root Cause Failure Analysis (RCFA), Reliability Centered Maintenance (RCM) or Equipment Criticality Analysis
Experience with CMMS (preferably SAP)
Experience with Safety Intrumented Systems (SIS) systems
Experience with electrically classified areas
Planning, problem solving and communication
Bias for Action & Achieving Results
Passion for Excellence
Professional manner and lead by example
Abide by safety, quality and all other site policies and procedures


You will get:

Competitive salary and benefits package
16, or more, weeks of maternity/paternity and co-parenting leave, according to local regulations
Training platform for all employees
Free well-being sessions (physical and psychological)


Additional information:
Location onsite: Welland Site, Niagara Falls (Ontario, Canada)
About Us

Syensqo is a science company developing groundbreaking solutions that enhance the way we live, work, travel and play. Inspired by the scientific councils which Ernest Solvay initiated in 1911, we bring great minds together to push the limits of science and innovation for the benefit of our customers, with a diverse, global team of more than 13,000 associates. Our solutions contribute to safer, cleaner, and more sustainable products found in homes, food and consumer goods, planes, cars, batteries, smart devices and health care applications. Our innovation power enables us to deliver on the ambition of a circular economy and explore breakthrough technologies that advance humanity.
At Syensqo, we seek to promote unity and not uniformity. We value the diversity that individuals bring and we invite you to consider a future with us, regardless of background, age, gender, national origin, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, ability or identity. We encourage individuals who may require any assistance or accommodations to let us know to ensure a seamless application experience. We are here to support you throughout the application journey and want to ensure all candidates are treated equally. If you are unsure whether you meet all the criteria or qualifications listed in the job description, we still encourage you to apply.

Title: Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
Who we are:

Want to make an impact? Join our pack and come work (and play!) with us.




We believe everyone deserves the unconditional love of a pet‚Äîand at Rover, our mission is to make it easier to experience that love. Founded in 2011, the Rover app and website connect dog and cat parents with loving pet sitters and dog walkers in neighborhoods across the US, Canada, and Europe. We empower our community of trusted pet sitters and dog walkers to run their own pet care businesses on Rover with the tools and security of a global company to back them.




Headquartered in Seattle, Washington, we work closely with our teams in Barcelona, San Antonio, Spokane, and remote locations. We‚Äôve got a reputation for being a great place to work, having been named among the 100 Best Companies to Work For in Seattle Business Magazine and Washington‚Äôs Best Workplaces in the Puget Sound Business Journal. We're an agile, fast-growing company, and our leadership comes from some of the world's most respected tech companies.




At Rover, our furry coworkers are just as important as our human ones‚Äîand we wouldn‚Äôt have it any other way. Along with making the joys of pet parenthood more accessible, we‚Äôre committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming community of pet people‚Äîand that starts with our employees.




Who we're looking for:

The Marketing Analytics team supports the company‚Äôs marketing efforts, while also working with teams throughout the organization. The analytics team is responsible for a number of business-critical reports and data models that our global marketing teams rely on for daily reporting, budgeting, and analysis. We measure marketing attribution to understand how people become Rover customers, provide campaign reporting to monitor trends in cost efficiency and optimization, deliver lifecycle data to action against a variety of customer behaviors, and narrate the business to identify and prioritize new opportunities.




We are looking for an Analyst to support our Growth, International Expansion, Lifecycle, and SEO stakeholders with a focus on improving our reporting and dashboard structure. The ideal candidate will have experience working closely with business stakeholders and building data-driven narratives that enable clear decision making.




*This is a hybrid position that has the minimum expectation to work out of our Barcelona Office in the Poblenou neighborhood two days per week on Mondays and Thursdays. For this reason, candidates must be based in Barcelona or willing to relocate.




Your Responsibilities:

Work closely with analytics peers and marketing teams to narrate trends and insights, with a particular focus on our customer acquisition marketing programs.
Design reports and dashboards that enable clear, data-driven decision-making for marketing and cross-functional teams.
Refine our marketing attribution models to drive optimal resource allocation across paid and organic marketing channels.
Expand your expertise by supporting experiments such as A/B testing and Market Match tests to optimize strategies across multiple marketing functions.




Your Qualifications:

At least 2 years experience working with complex datasets to support business decision making.
Fluency in SQL.
Data visualisation tool experience (e.g. Mode, Looker, Tableau, etc.)
Ability to adapt your communication style to translate complex data insights for different audiences.
You have experience in owning small-to-medium projects from design to completion with limited guidance from your manager.
You understand when you are blocked, proactively seeking out for help within the team or the organization to move the project forward.




Nice to Have:

Python or R familiarity is helpful, but we welcome candidates eager to develop these skills.
Experience evaluating results of A/B tests as well as expertise in statistical analysis.
Understanding of marketing metrics such as clicks, CPC, CTR, impressions, and unit economics like customer LTV, payback period, and CAC.




Benefits of working at Rover:

Competitive compensation
Long-term incentive plan with a company performance-based cash payout
Permanent contract
Pension plan
Meal tickets through Cobee
Generous PTO allowance
Private health insurance
Discounted gym membership
Bring your dog to work (and unlimited puppy time)
Monetary help for adopting a dog or cat plus yearly credit to use on our platform
A wide variety of snacks, fresh fruit, and beverages in our kitchen to keep yourself going
Regular team activities, including happy hours, game nights, and more




Rover is an equal-opportunity employer committed to promoting a diverse, inclusive, and inventive environment with the best employees. We‚Äôre driven by seeing our people succeed and grow, and we work to ensure everyone contributes to their fullest potential. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, protected veteran status, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
BELIEVE IN LIFE. Join a company that takes you further!




Galenicum is one of the fastest growing companies in the pharmaceutical sector! We are enthusiastic about life, devoting our talent and effort to providing high-quality affordable pharmaceuticals worldwide.




People are the key to our present and future success, so we carefully select candidates that meet the requirements for each position, however most importantly, who also fit with our cultural DNA and values.




Here‚Äôs the lowdown on what your role will actually look like (spoiler alert: it‚Äôs awesome!)




We are looking for Data Analyst to join our Data & BI team.




What you'll be rocking:




Design and Develop Dashboards: Actively participate in the design, development, and maintenance of interactive business intelligence dashboards and reports using BI tools (TABLEAU), transforming complex data into clear and actionable visualizations for various departments.
Data Transformation and Enrichment: Collaborate in the creation and optimization of data pipelines (ETL/ELT) for extracting, cleaning, transforming, and loading information, ensuring data quality and availability for analysis (TABLEAU-PREP & GOOGLE BIG QUERY).
Strategic Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams (sales, marketing, production, etc.) to understand their information needs, translate business requirements into effective data solutions, and ensure that BI tools meet their expectations.
Data Quality Assurance: Conduct regular data audits to ensure the accuracy and quality of data used in business intelligence initiatives.
Support and Training: Provide training and support to internal users on BI tools and data-driven processes, contributing to the creation of a data-driven culture.
Continuous Improvement: Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in business intelligence and data analytics, proposing and implementing improvements in data management processes and the overall BI strategy.
Technological Adaptation: Actively support the organization during tool changes/updates to ensure




What you bring to the table:




Experience: 1 year of previous experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a related role is preferred but not required. Candidates with relevant internships or academic projects will also be considered.




Educational milestone:




Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Computer Science, Data Analytics, Information Systems, or a related field.
Languages: Excellent level of scientific and business English, both spoken and written.




Your key superpowers:




Proficiency in SQL and Excel for data manipulation and analysis.
Familiarity with BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and ETL/ELT processes.
Understanding of data visualization techniques and best practices. Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work in multidisciplinary teams.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple tasks simultaneously.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies, and actively contribute to team growth.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft is a global leader in gaming with teams across the world creating original and memorable gaming experiences, from Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Rainbow Six, to Just Dance and more. We believe diverse perspectives help both players and teams thrive. If you‚Äôre passionate about innovation and pushing entertainment boundaries, join our journey and help us create the unknown!

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile‚ÄØbrings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we‚Äôre transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft‚Äôs Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid work model.
Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule:‚ÄØ40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM ‚Äì 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount‚ÄØand Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).



Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender sexual orientation, age or disability status.

Title: Junior Portfolio Data Analyst
Description:
In a nutshell üìå

Position: Junior Portfolio Data Analyst

Location: Madrid, onsite

Experience: At least 1 year in data analysis or a similar role




Want to know more? üëá




INSUD PHARMA operates across the entire pharmaceutical value chain, bringing specialized knowledge and experience in scientific research, development, manufacturing, sales, and marketing of a wide range of active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs), finished dosage forms (FDFs), and branded pharmaceutical products, adding value to human and animal health.

INSUD PHARMA‚Äôs activity is organized into three synergistic business areas: Industrial (Chemo), Branded (Exeltis), and Biotech (mAbxience), with over 9,000 professionals in more than 50 countries, 20 state-of-the-art facilities, 15 specialized R&D centers, 12 commercial offices, and more than 35 pharmaceutical subsidiaries serving 1,150 clients in 96 countries worldwide. INSUD PHARMA believes in innovation and sustainable development.

Are you ready to be a #Challenger? üí™




What are we looking for? üîé




Support the Business Development team in identifying, analyzing, and selecting products to develop, both generic and innovative.
Perform quantitative (market data) and qualitative (strategic evaluations) analyses within portfolio selection and new product development.
Regularly monitor competitor performance.
Create KPIs and dashboards to provide insights into the execution quality of the Business Development and Portfolio teams.
Develop benchmarks to monitor company performance against peers.
Understand and feel comfortable with clinical and scientific language.
Work on strategic or operational projects.




The challenge! üöÄ

√á

Translate business rules into data logic to support strategic decision-making.
Collaborate closely with different departments to ensure quality and relevance of analysis.
Present results in a structured, clear, and convincing manner.




What do you need? ü§ì




Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Business (double major or Master‚Äôs in Data Science is a plus). Knowledge in Health Sciences is valued.
At least 1 year of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
Proficiency in Python and SQL.
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
Excellent analytical and conceptual skills.
Effective communication skills in English, both written and verbal.
Investigative and curious mindset with strong ability to understand business rules and translate them into data logic.
Strong interpersonal skills and desire to work in a highly collaborative environment.




How will the selection process be? üïµÔ∏è




Initial contact by phone or email.
1 or 2 interviews, either virtual or onsite.
Continuous communication about the status of the process.

HTML:
In a nutshell üìå

Position: Junior Portfolio Data Analyst

Location: Madrid, onsite

Experience: At least 1 year in data analysis or a similar role


Want to know more? üëá


INSUD PHARMA operates across the entire pharmaceutical value chain, bringing specialized knowledge and experience in scientific research, development, manufacturing, sales, and marketing of a wide range of active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs), finished dosage forms (FDFs), and branded pharmaceutical products, adding value to human and animal health.

INSUD PHARMA‚Äôs activity is organized into three synergistic business areas: Industrial (Chemo), Branded (Exeltis), and Biotech (mAbxience), with over 9,000 professionals in more than 50 countries, 20 state-of-the-art facilities, 15 specialized R&D centers, 12 commercial offices, and more than 35 pharmaceutical subsidiaries serving 1,150 clients in 96 countries worldwide. INSUD PHARMA believes in innovation and sustainable development.

Are you ready to be a #Challenger? üí™


What are we looking for? üîé


  • Support the Business Development team in identifying, analyzing, and selecting products to develop, both generic and innovative.
  • Perform quantitative (market data) and qualitative (strategic evaluations) analyses within portfolio selection and new product development.
  • Regularly monitor competitor performance.
  • Create KPIs and dashboards to provide insights into the execution quality of the Business Development and Portfolio teams.
  • Develop benchmarks to monitor company performance against peers.
  • Understand and feel comfortable with clinical and scientific language.
  • Work on strategic or operational projects.


The challenge! üöÄ

√á

  • Translate business rules into data logic to support strategic decision-making.
  • Collaborate closely with different departments to ensure quality and relevance of analysis.
  • Present results in a structured, clear, and convincing manner.


What do you need? ü§ì


  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Business (double major or Master‚Äôs in Data Science is a plus). Knowledge in Health Sciences is valued.
  • At least 1 year of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
  • Proficiency in Python and SQL.
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar.
  • Excellent analytical and conceptual skills.
  • Effective communication skills in English, both written and verbal.
  • Investigative and curious mindset with strong ability to understand business rules and translate them into data logic.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and desire to work in a highly collaborative environment.


How will the selection process be? üïµÔ∏è


  • Initial contact by phone or email.
  • 1 or 2 interviews, either virtual or onsite.
  • Continuous communication about the status of the process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas ‚Äì immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care ‚Äì and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

Job Description

The Data Analyst will work within Customer Engagement Analytics team in Spain, to provide technical expertise in Advance/Predictive/Prescriptive Analytics. The key responsibilities of the role will be to contribute to AbbVie Data Analytics projects and support Data Science projects. Should be highly analytical with love and high affinity for analysis, mathematics and statistics. Additionally, not only should be familiar with quantitative methodologies and programming but also keen on business acumen. The Data Analyst should have passion for data analysis, data quality and accuracy, data exploration, machine learning and out of the box thinking.

Key responsibilities:

Serve as a relevant member of Customer Engagement Analytics, working in close partnership with the rest of team member and Global Winning with Data team to implement global and local initiatives in the affiliate, becoming a trusted partner of the CEx local team.

Develop in collaboration with the commercial teams and other CEx teams, advanced analytics, identify synergies, optimize reporting strategy to generate business relevant outcomes.

Master in different Foundry datasets of varying complexity and size levels and develop new ways to generate creative predictive analytic solutions to work around data limitations.

Identify best practices and extend them to the rest of the organization in terms of repoting & analytics, Proactively identify new analytical approaches that would improve our ability to answer key business questions, by closely collaborating with key business partners to transform key business questions to insights.

Work with business stakeholders to define key business questions, requirements, timelines, objectives and success factors for winning with data initiatives.

Qualifications

BS degree in mathematics, statistics or engineering, computer science or economics complemented with a master in Big Data, Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Data Science or equivalent.

Portfolio of work demonstrating data science applications.

Minimum of 2 years of applied data science in fields such as data engineering, predictive modelling,

Experience developing and executing data analytica to address key business questions with positive and measurable outcomes.

Experience analyzing and drawing insights from key internally and externally generated data sets.

Essential skills:

Analytical reasoning abilities, intellectual curiosity, strong business acumen and creative problem solving.

Ability to interact effectively with/present to (verbally or written) to all levels of the organization.

Ability to be agile and nimble changing business conditions, strong collaborative relationships, teamwork across different functions and teams to contribute to productive culture.

Lead strategically and create trust within the team.

Additional Information

AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives and serving our community.‚ÄØ Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled.

US & Puerto Rico only - to learn more, visit https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/equal-employment-opportunity-employer.html

US & Puerto Rico applicants seeking a reasonable accommodation, click here to learn more:

https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/reasonable-accommodations.html

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Kapsch is one of Austria's most successful global technology companies. With its comprehensive ITS (Intelligent Transportation Systems) portfolio, Kapsch is actively addressing the challenges of the present and the future with intelligent mobility solutions in a wide range of application areas. As a family-owned company founded in 1892 and headquartered in Vienna, Kapsch can look back on 130 years of experience with the future.




We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst and Data Visualization Engineer to support the development of our Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) portfolio. Our products include data and video analytics platforms for traffic management and tolling, an OCR (Optical Character Recognition) engine, and stereo vision cameras for vehicle classification. In this role, you will work with large and complex datasets to extract insights that drive innovation, optimize system performance, and inform product decisions. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams - including software engineering, AI/ML, and product management - and build dashboards to visualize key performance indicators for real-time monitoring and decision support.




Your responsibilities:

Generate actionable insights from large datasets to improve traffic and tolling solutions.
Design and build dashboards (e.g., in Qlik, Power BI) to visualize complex data and support real-time operational decisions.
Work with engineering and product teams to develop user-centric analytics features (e.g., alert systems, operator dashboards).
Analyze traffic sensor data to optimize tolling accuracy and reduce misclassification and revenue loss.
Identify patterns and trends from traffic data to support new use cases, such as congestion prediction or adaptive signaling.
Monitor AI model performance and support ongoing model retraining and customization across varying environments.
Use predictive analytics to anticipate traffic bottlenecks, optimize toll operations, and improve safety.
Support regulatory compliance by automating reporting processes and ensuring data integrity.




Required Skills & Qualifications:

Strong SQL skills and experience with relational and columnar databases.
Solid understanding of dimensional data models (star/snowflake schemas).
Experience with Python and SQL for data manipulation and extraction
Hands-on experience with Linux, Bash, Gitlab/Github, Cloud Computing
Proficiency in QLIK Sense, Power BI or similar dashboard tools.
Experience working with large datasets (‚Äúbig data‚Äù) in operational environments.
Analytical mindset and solution driven personality.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
You practice and live the agile mindset
Good oral and written English
Experience in treating with customers
Presentations skills




Nice to have:

Experience in tolling or traffic management is a plus.
Experience with traffic related models like DATEX2, SIRI, GTFS, MDS, etc.
Experience with traffic simulators like SUMO, Aimsun, PTV Vissim/Vissum




Our offer:

Pernanent role
Flexible working hours
Hybrid working model (2 days at the office/week)
30 business days of annual leave
Flexible remuneration plan
Challenging the limits of mobility for a healthy world without congestion
Adiverse and dynamic international working environment of Kapsch TrafficCom and opportunities for personal growth
Possibility to work in an international company that operates in a dynamic industry where the working environment favors the professional growth
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Fintech
Description:
At Leadtech, we've been redefining digital businesses since 2009, creating innovative online solutions that reach millions of users every month. With a diverse team of over 700 members from 23+ nationalities, we're united by a passion for creativity and collaboration.

We specialize in delivering user-centric experiences across web and mobile platforms, where people can connect with our products like never before.

We're proud of our global reach and committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where every individual contributes to our shared vision of bringing cutting-edge projects to life. Learn more about our journey and mission on our About Us page!

About The Role

Due to continuous growth, we are seeking an ambitious and detail-oriented Data Analyst - Payments Specialist to drive data-led insights and support our payments strategy during a critical expansion phase. As a fast-growing B2C company with a strong presence in the US and European markets, we are focused on scaling our brand, optimising payment performance, and enhancing fraud prevention. This role requires a strong analytical mindset and a deep understanding of digital payment ecosystems, transactional data, and customer behaviour. You will play a key role in analysing payment trends, identifying inefficiencies, preventing fraud, and enabling data-driven decision-making across our payments and risk operations.

Key Responsibilities:

You're our perfect candidate if you:


Investigate, prioritise, and document anomalies in payments data and fraud patterns to support rapid issue resolution and risk mitigation
Use advanced Excel skills (e.g., VLOOKUPs, pivot tables, IF conditions) to analyse payment transactions, identify unusual behaviour, and support reconciliation efforts
Ensure data accuracy across payment systems by validating transaction records and flagging inconsistencies or suspicious activity
Identify trends in payment failures, chargebacks, and fraud attempts to drive process improvements and reduce financial risk
Implement consumer data acquisition strategies and e-commerce analytics with a focus on optimising payment funnel performance and detecting fraud signals
Build and apply consumer segmentation and profiling models to detect high-risk behaviours and improve fraud prevention tactics
Respond to data analysis requests from fraud teams, compliance, finance, and operations with a focus on payment performance and fraud detection insights
Retrieve, clean, and prepare transactional data for deep analysis of payment patterns, fraud triggers, and refund behaviours
Contribute to daily, weekly, monthly, and annual reporting on payments KPIs, fraud rates, authorization success rates, and risk events
Perform in-depth analysis on large volumes of payments and fraud-related data using advanced techniques to extract actionable insights
Define and enforce data quality standards specific to payments and fraud monitoring systems, ensuring high confidence in real-time decisions
Maintain expertise in analytics tools and practices relevant to payments processing, fraud detection, and compliance reporting
Collaborate with engineering, product, risk, and business intelligence teams to embed data quality controls across payments and fraud pipelines
Create and optimise metrics and dashboards to monitor payment success, fraud incidents, transaction declines, and risk thresholds
Communicate key insights on payment performance and fraud trends to stakeholders, driving cross-functional initiatives for improvement
Research discrepancies in payment data and correct records to ensure accurate transaction histories and trustworthy reporting
Monitor real-time analytics dashboards for drops in payment success rates or spikes in fraud indicators, enabling swift investigation and escalation
Review and act on data control alerts related to payment processing, chargebacks, fraud scoring models, and transaction integrity
Continuously analyse payment flows to detect fraud attempts, reduce false positives, and improve approval rates through data-driven strategies


Requirements

Your expertise in a nutshell:


3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, in payments, fraud, or transactional data
Strong SQL skills and experience with large datasets and relational databases
Proficient in BI/reporting tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and Excel.
Solid understanding of digital payment systems, chargebacks, fraud indicators, and PSPs
Experience with data modelling, ETL processes, and data quality best practices
Familiarity with Python, R, or statistical tools (SPSS, SAS) is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail
Ability to communicate findings clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Proactive, well-organized, and adaptable in a fast-paced environment
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Computer Science)


YOUR TEAM:


We're team-first. If you believe in the power of collaboration and thatthe team's success is your success,then you're one of us!
Fun is fundamental. We believe in forming strong bonds in and outside the oce. That's why we have a team-building budget and organize activities to enjoy ourselves.
Positivity wins the day. Bring a positive attitude and communicate openly. Self-awareness and an openness to learn are always a plus


Benefits

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US?

Growth and career development


At Leadtech, we prioritize your growth. Enjoy a flexible career path with personalized internal training and an annual budget for external learning opportunities


Work-Life balance


Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. start, 3:30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer!


Comprehensive benefits


Competitive salary, full-time permanent contract, and top-tier private health insurance (including dental and psychological services)
25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options‚Äîno blackout days!


Unique Perks


If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you'll find it complete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views
Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary


Join us in an environment where you're free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you'll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.
Show more

  • 3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, in payments, fraud, or transactional data
  • Strong SQL skills and experience with large datasets and relational databases
  • Proficient in BI/reporting tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and Excel.
  • Solid understanding of digital payment systems, chargebacks, fraud indicators, and PSPs
  • Experience with data modelling, ETL processes, and data quality best practices
  • Familiarity with Python, R, or statistical tools (SPSS, SAS) is a plus
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail
  • Ability to communicate findings clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Proactive, well-organized, and adaptable in a fast-paced environment
  • Fluent in English, both written and spoken
  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Computer Science)

YOUR TEAM:

  • We're team-first. If you believe in the power of collaboration and thatthe team's success is your success,then you're one of us!
  • Fun is fundamental. We believe in forming strong bonds in and outside the oce. That's why we have a team-building budget and organize activities to enjoy ourselves.
  • Positivity wins the day. Bring a positive attitude and communicate openly. Self-awareness and an openness to learn are always a plus

Benefits

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US?

Growth and career development

  • At Leadtech, we prioritize your growth. Enjoy a flexible career path with personalized internal training and an annual budget for external learning opportunities

Work-Life balance

  • Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. start, 3:30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer!

Comprehensive benefits

  • Competitive salary, full-time permanent contract, and top-tier private health insurance (including dental and psychological services)
  • 25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options‚Äîno blackout days!

Unique Perks

  • If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you'll find it complete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views
  • Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary

Join us in an environment where you're free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you'll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
HTML:
About ExoClick:


ExoClick is an innovative and global ad company serving 20 billion daily geo-targeted ads to web and mobile advertisers & publishers. We are part of EXOGROUP, a set of companies made up of +200 talents and offering a wide range of services within the digital business landscape with headquarters in Barcelona and offices in Dublin, Porto, Valencia, Tarragona, and Buenos Aires.


Role


As a Junior Data Analyst you will be part of the Analytics team at EXOGROUP, which is a highly skilled and qualified department that has diverse responsibilities.


Together with the Director of Analytics & Data Science and the Analytics team you will develop and maintain data reports that provide critical business visibility on key revenue and profit trends, by product, market, vertical and traffic sources. Additionally, you will collaborate with IT and Product teams to identify potential improvements in the platform by analysing and designing algorithms.


Tasks


  • Structure masses of information, identify data-driven trends and understand what really matters and why.
  • Collect KPIs and design/define visualizations.
  • Deliver insights and analytics across the company's operation and advertising departments.
  • Ability to identify and escalate issues and opportunities ahead of time helping to reduce impact and improve financial / performance implications.
  • Develop and maintain different internal applications and dashboards.
  • Together with the Analytics team, you will develop and promote actionable insights to increase the profitability of the company.


Skills


  • You thrive on data and have a highly analytical mind.
  • Degree in computer science or mathematical sciences.
  • Managing and prioritising workload, taking ownership of all assigned tasks.
  • You feel comfortable retrieving, cleaning, tidying and processing data from different sources and formats. You have a general understanding of how web applications work.
  • You have programming experience in Python.
  • You are familiar with SQL and Git.
  • Experience with advanced statistical methodology, data and datasets is a plus.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • The desire and agility to work in a fast-paced and ever evolving environment.
  • You thrive on data and have a highly analytical mind.
  • Degree in computer science or mathematical sciences.
  • Managing and prioritising workload, taking ownership of all assigned tasks.
  • You feel comfortable retrieving, cleaning, tidying and processing data from different sources and formats. You have a general understanding of how web applications work.
  • You have programming experience in Python.
  • You are familiar with SQL and Git.
  • Experience with advanced statistical methodology, data and datasets is a plus.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • The desire and agility to work in a fast-paced and ever evolving environment.


What you'll find working at ExoClick:


We offer a position in a young, dynamic and international team with exceptional working conditions in unique offices high up in the Torre Mapfre, one of Barcelona's world-renowned landmarks, located right on the city's seafront.

Additionally, we offer the opportunity for permanent training, personal development, ambitious career growth, and a competitive salary.


Most of all, we offer a position in a team that thrives on achievement, success, and leadership within our industry. Our core company value is innovation: where people and creativity drive innovative technology. If you have an innovative, winning mentality, this position is for you!


Our company benefits:


  • Flexitime and summer schedule;
  • Private health insurance;
  • Your Birthday off as a paid holiday;
  • Flexible compensation plan: travel, meals & childcare;
  • Additional internal and external training through our EXOGROUP University program;
  • English, Portuguese & Spanish classes;
  • training budget & study leave;
  • Employee referral program bonus - You can earn 2500Eur by referring someone!
  • Exciting team buildings in locations such as Ibiza;
  • Office games room/chill-out zone;
  • Organic fruit;
  • Wednesday team breakfast;
  • Yoga classes;
  • Subsidised Well-Being activities;
  • Calm App;
  • Massages;
  • Subsidized catering;
  • Flexible remote work;
  • Home office set up budget of 500 Eur;


Is this not the right role for you? Then make sure to check out all other roles we have open for you on our careers website.


The companies that are part of EXOGROUP are the data controllers regarding your personal data, in order to consider your application for present or future vacancies in our organization. For more information about the processing of your personal data and on how to exercise your rights of access, rectification, suppression, limitation, portability and opposition please visit the Protection Informative Clause Candidates.

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:

¬øC√≥mo ser√° tu d√≠a a d√≠a?

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Prime Insights

Prime Insights is a fast-growing US-based company connecting millions of users to market research surveys through proprietary panel apps. With a focus on slick UX, global reach, and high user incentives, we're building the next generation of rewarded apps ‚Äî and we‚Äôre just getting started.

At Prime Insights, we‚Äôre building one of the most powerful app ecosystems in the survey and reward space, and we‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst to join our performance team.

We believe great marketing decisions start with great data. As our Data Analyst, you‚Äôll transform complex data into clear, actionable insights‚Äîhelping us drive strategy and accelerate growth. You‚Äôll work closely with our Head of Growth & Data, who‚Äôs deeply involved in both analytics and marketing. Together, you‚Äôll elevate our data operations and make a direct impact on the business.

We‚Äôre especially looking for someone with hands-on experience in the app business, with a deep understanding of user behavior, mobile attribution, and Mobile Measurement Partners (MMPs) like AppsFlyer, Adjust, or Branch. If you thrive on turning data into performance improvements, we‚Äôd love to talk.







What You‚Äôll Do

Own and enhance Metabase dashboards: Build and refine dashboards and reports to support app and web marketing initiatives.
Advanced SQL analysis: Write, debug, and optimize complex SQL queries that power critical reporting.
Collaborate with marketing: Translate marketing questions into robust data insights‚Äîcovering ROAS, cohort LTV, attribution, channel efficiency, and more.
Lead attribution work: Analyze and improve attribution models across app and web, including SKAN, multi-touch, and probabilistic frameworks.
Work with MMP data: Integrate, validate, and analyze performance data from partners like AppsFlyer, Adjust, and Branch.
Support web analytics: Help drive performance reporting for web channels, leveraging tools like Google Analytics.
Identify and fix data gaps: Spot inconsistencies or missing data and propose scalable solutions across app and web analytics.




What We‚Äôre Looking For

2+ years of experience as a data or business analyst, ideally in mobile marketing or app-based businesses.
Expertise in SQL-you‚Äôre confident with complex queries and performance tuning.
Experience with Metabase or similar BI tools (Looker, Tableau, Power BI).
Strong marketing analytics knowledge: ROAS, LTV, cohorting, user acquisition, and attribution.
Practical experience with MMPs such as AppsFlyer, Adjust, or Branch.
Familiarity with SKAN and probabilistic attribution methods.
Solid understanding of web analytics and tools like Google Analytics.
A proactive, analytical mindset-you don‚Äôt just answer questions, you uncover opportunities.




How to Apply:

Use the Easy Apply button.




‚ùóImportant: We are not considering freelancers working on multiple projects simultaneously. This is a full-time position for a dedicated Data Analyst who‚Äôs ready to fully commit to a single product ecosystem and contribute meaningfully to its long-term success.

Title: Junior BI Analyst
Description:
Overview: The position of Junior BI Analyst is an entry-level role. The role will include managing ad-hoc reporting/visualization tasks for production, sales, client reporting and more functions in the company.




Description:

Design & implement reports, dashboards, and visualizations using data visualization business intelligence tools
Optimize reporting dashboards with a focus on user experience, performance, flexibility, testability, and standardization
Working closely with stakeholders to understand requirements and provide the best possible solution
Make complex concepts simple and easy to understand by those around you through effective communication, planning and strategic execution
Maintain documentation for design, development and reporting work
Work within our systems and with BI team members to achieve high standards of data integrity, ensuring supporting metrics are accurate and complete
Working within team processes, data governance and security frameworks




Required Skills:

At least 1 year of experience working in a BI environment
Experience using Business Intelligence tools, such as Tableau or PowerBI
Experience in creating interactive dashboards
Minimum Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent / in the process of completing those studies.
Ability to learn new skills quickly
Ability to maintain professionalism, focus and result-orientation under pressure and tight deadlines
Attention to detail
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) in English
Exceptional problem-solving/critical thinking skills
Experience working in a corporate environment




Desired Skills:

Exposure to Knime, Request Tracker (RT), Snowflake
Prior translation industry experience
Understanding of relational databases
Fluency in a foreign language

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you ready to join a leading global renewable energy company that is making a positive impact on the world?

We are X-ELIO: a Brookfield-owned leader in the renewable sector, that has built over 3 GW of renewable energy projects (solar/BESS) across 13 countries and is developing 13 GW more, and we are looking for you!




Reporting to: Revenue Management Data Team Lead

Based in: Madrid, Spain

Open opportunity: Markets Data Analyst




The selected professional will maintain and optimize database systems while supporting the development of tools to facilitate revenue analysis and ensuring alignment with the company‚Äôs goals.




What will you do?




Perform preventive and corrective maintenance on current databases, ensuring availability and performance while monitoring and optimizing database efficiency through query and configuration adjustments.
Design and program a revenue calculation tool in Python, collaborating with Revenue and Commercial teams to define requirements and adapt functionality, ensuring accurate and real-time revenue data access.
Act as a technical support contact for various departments, assisting with issue resolution and improvements related to database management and revenue tools.
Document maintenance procedures, configurations, and developments while identifying infrastructure improvement opportunities to facilitate future enhancements.
Work closely with IT, Commercial, and Operations teams to ensure databases and tools align with business needs and participate in collaborative projects to prioritize strategic objectives.




What do we need?




At least two years of experience in database management and programming.
Proficiency in Python and database management tools.
Strong interest in renewable energy.
Ability to collaborate across interdisciplinary teams.
Advanced level of English and Spanish.




What do we offer?




Career development in a leading international environment.
Yearly bonus based on objectives.
Flexible work schedule.
Hybrid Remote work model (2 remote days per week)
Ticket Restaurant.
Additional benefits (Healthy X-Elio, Workshops, Green Mobility programs, etc.)




Join a team of passionate and talented individuals making a positive impact in the world!




If you are interested in the position and want to know more, apply to the link. For any other query, contact us at recruitment@x-elio.com.




At X-ELIO, we embrace diversity and inclusivity. We welcome applicants from all walks of life and are committed to a fair and unbiased hiring process that respects individuals regardless of their gender, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, or any other personal characteristics. We encourage candidates from diverse backgrounds to submit their applications.

Title: Sustainability Data & Analytics Lead
Description:
Company Description

Syngenta Group, a global leader in agricultural technology and innovation, employs 60,000 people across more than 100 countries to transform agriculture through tailor-made solutions for farmers, society, and our planet. Our diverse portfolio encompasses seeds, crop protection, nutrition products, agronomic solutions, and digital services, all designed to help farmers produce healthy food, feed, fiber, and fuel while conserving natural resources and protecting the environment. Our mission is to address critical challenges such as climate change and food security through sustainable practices and cutting-edge solutions, while safeguarding the planet's resources.

Job Description

Join our global Crop Protection (CP) Sustainability Business Partners (BPs) team as the Sustainability Data & Analytics Lead. You'll develop and implement tools delivering crucial insights for sustainable portfolio development, with special focus on our Portfolio Sustainability Framework (PSF). This framework provides transparency to external stakeholders on our portfolio's sustainability profile while facilitating internal decision-making.

Key Accountabilities

Portfolio Sustainability Framework (PSF)


Own the CP PSF technical platform, including Qlik tools, data models, and automation with other tools and our data lake (GAIA - data bricks).
Develop global and regional dashboards delivering actionable insights supporting business processes (KPI setting, improvement plans, stage gate promotions).
Deliver data engineering solutions to drive further automation of PSF platform and simulation tools.
Explore AI opportunities to enhance productivity and workflows.
Perform technical and data quality checks ensuring reliable PSF reports delivery.
Maintain robust documentation, SOPs, and support models for the PSF.


Sustainability Data Solutions Operations


Define and implement sustainability data acquisition strategy, including farmer practice data supporting metrics like carbon emissions and biodiversity.
Collaborate with internal/external partners on digital tools and methodologies (e.g., Cool Farm Alliance, AgroLens, Cropwise).
Work closely with Sustainability BPs to provide data and insights across all product lines.
Support development of tools enabling accurate reporting on Syngenta Group's sustainability priorities.
Understand stakeholder needs to develop or improve solutions for data tools, analytics and modeling.


Critical Success Factors & Key Challenges


Technical Mastery: Advanced proficiency in data engineering and innovative technologies.
Data Quality Assurance: Maintain high standards of data integrity and accuracy.
Stakeholder Management: Effective collaboration across diverse teams.
Strategic Alignment: Ensure data solutions support business goals and sustainability priorities.
Project Execution: Efficient management and timely delivery of complex data projects.


Qualifications

Experience & Expertise:


Data engineering and visualization skills (Python/R/dash, SQL, Qlik, cloud services like AWS).
Experience with simulations and "what-if" scenarios; Machine Learning and predictive analytics preferred.
Delivering data-driven insights.
Managing complex, multi-stakeholder projects.
Analyzing complex datasets.
Cross-functional and international teamwork.


Additional Information

Location: Remote working is possible within the European Union and UK.


Extensive benefits package including a generous pension scheme, bonus scheme, private medical & life insurance.
Flexible working arrangements.
We offer a position which contributes to valuable and impactful work in a stimulating and international environment.
Learning culture (Together we Grow) and wide range of training options.


Equal Opportunity

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.

Title: Administrativo/a Banca Comercial
Description:
ConfiARTE selecciona para importante entidad financiera nacional administrativos/as comerciales.


Tareas


Apoyo administrativo: Los administrativos comerciales brindan apoyo administrativo general, como manejo de correos electr√≥nicos, llamadas telef√≥nicas, correspondencia y coordinaci√≥n de reuniones.




Gesti√≥n de documentos: Son responsables de gestionar y mantener actualizada la documentaci√≥n relacionada con las transacciones comerciales, como contratos, formularios de solicitud, registros de clientes, entre otros.




Procesamiento de transacciones: Los administrativos comerciales pueden estar a cargo de procesar y registrar transacciones comerciales, como aperturas de cuentas, solicitudes de pr√©stamos, transferencias de fondos y pagos.




Atenci√≥n al cliente: Interact√∫an con los clientes para proporcionar informaci√≥n sobre productos y servicios financieros, resolver consultas y brindar asistencia en general.




Seguimiento y reportes: Deben hacer seguimiento de las transacciones, actualizaciones de clientes y generar informes peri√≥dicos sobre las actividades comerciales.




Coordinaci√≥n interna: Colaboran con otros departamentos internos, como el departamento de cr√©dito, tesorer√≠a, riesgos, para garantizar la correcta ejecuci√≥n de las transacciones comerciales.




Cumplimiento normativo: Deben cumplir con las regulaciones y pol√≠ticas internas y externas establecidas por la entidad financiera, como las relacionadas con el lavado de dinero y la protecci√≥n de datos.


Requisitos


Educaci√≥n y formaci√≥n: Diplomatura, licenciatura universitaria o grado equivalente.




Conocimientos financieros: Los administrativos comerciales deben tener un buen entendimiento de los productos y servicios financieros ofrecidos por la entidad, as√≠ como de los procedimientos y regulaciones relacionadas con la industria financiera.




Habilidades de comunicaci√≥n: Es fundamental contar con habilidades de comunicaci√≥n efectiva, tanto verbal como escrita, ya que los administrativos comerciales interact√∫an con clientes, proveedores y otros miembros del equipo.




Habilidades organizativas: Deben tener habilidades s√≥lidas de organizaci√≥n para administrar y mantener actualizados los registros, documentaci√≥n y archivos relacionados con las transacciones y actividades comerciales.




Orientaci√≥n al cliente: Los administrativos comerciales deben ser amigables, atentos y tener una actitud orientada al cliente. Deben ser capaces de brindar un servicio excepcional y resolver consultas o problemas de manera efectiva.


Beneficios


Incorporaci√≥n indefinida en uno de los grupos financieros m√°s importantes del pais. Excelente paquete retributivo.




Si quieres tener un buen plan de carrera en una gran entidad con un magnifico ambiente de trabajo esta es tu oportunidad. trabajo indefinido.

Title: IT Support / IT Service Desk / Client Support
Description:
Company Description

Creating a future worth living for future generations gets us out of bed every morning. Depending on the project, we are consultants, implementers, or both for sustainable, innovative and economical solutions for real estate, industry, energy and infrastructure. Our more than 6,500 employees at 70 locations worldwide support our customers in interdisciplinary teams. Our thinking is both visionary and realistic. We work independently and as part of a team. With passion and the latest technologies. We unite. Join us at Dreso and let‚Äôs create a world we want to live in.

Job Description

Sustainable, digital, innovative, and economical‚Äîthese four aspects are at the heart of everything we do. We are the innovative partner for consulting, planning, construction, and operations. As part of our Client Support team, you will support our internal customers from the specialist departments with your expertise in a broad range of services. Are you communicative, a team player, responsible, and solution-oriented? Then join our international IT team at our Spanish location in Malaga or elsewhere in Spain. We offer you a diverse role in a dynamic IT environment and a team that will warmly welcome you and values a professional, high-performing, and modern IT landscape. You are responsible for all our international location where we have no IT people on site.

Your Specific Responsibilities


First point of contact and problem-solver for our team regarding hardware and software questions, as well as a competent contact for our users in 2nd level and VIP support‚Äîeither on site or via remote support
Carrying out error analyses and initiating appropriate measures
Monitoring and maintaining IT systems in the Microsoft client environment
Supporting IT projects, such as software and client hardware rollouts and migration scenarios
Creating documentation and guides to assist end users, as well as conducting basic user training sessions
Close cooperation and coordination with IT colleagues throughout Germany


Qualifications


Completed training as an IT specialist for system integration, a comparable IT education, or initial experience in IT support
Excellent skills in analyzing, resolving, and documenting errors in operating systems and user applications (Windows, Office 365, standard office programs)
Basic knowledge of network technologies and cloud services
Good command of English spoken and written.
Strong customer orientation and a process-oriented working style
Willing to travel to international locations, which could be up to 50% of your time


Additional Information


A dynamic and collaborative environment where cybersecurity is a strategic priority
A team that values creativity, initiative, and continuous improvement
To ensure your work-life balance, we offer the option of mobile working
We promote your professional and personal development through individual training and further education at the Drees & Sommer Academy
We support your health with a bonus for sports enthusiasts. We offer the possibility of subscribing to a private health insurance policy
Employees benefit from tax advantages related to their commuting expenses for the office
Fiscal advantages for employees expenses in meal costs during the worktime. Employee referral program with attractive bonus scheme
Supporting career and family by receiving tax benefits for kindergarten expenses
