Title: Data Engineer
Description:
At ING we are looking for Data Engineer







Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Data Engineer to join our DataLake Team of Data Management




The Data Management Tribe is focused on being Data Best-in-class, by ensuring the right data is in the right place at the right time for the right people to ignite the Data Spark.

In order to achieve that mission, we are currently looking for a Data Engineer that would be part of an international project, collaborative between different countries, developing in a Cloud & DevOps environment.

You would be focused on maintaining and evolving our informational platforms, which aims to be used for Data Management, as well as Regulatory & Analytical Reporting at ING.

We work in an Agile & DevOps environment, where Scrum & Kanban are part of our One Agile Way of Working. You would be part of a Scrum Team, working on two-weeks sprints and using Azure as a key-tool for our Software Development Life Cycle and keeping our IT Risk under control.




Your key responsibilities:




As a Data Engineer you will:




Ensure best practices within technical design, development of ETL processes and modelling informational solutions.
Monitor end-to-end processes, ensuring their operation, detection of technical issues and search for solutions based on Data.
Care of platforms sustainability, within Minimum Standards from IT and Risk perspective.
Guarantee that ETL delivered and promoted through Azure pipelines and modelling informational solutions are aligned with our best practices.
Analysis of business needs for implementation and propose IT solutions
Collaborate with different areas contributing to Spain ING Data Strategy




What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!

A person who works and acts rapidly based on intuition, instead of reasoning step-by-step; Knows the difference between important and less important details.

A person flexible and adaptable, capable of facing uncertainty, acquiring knowledge in various disciplines and updating it as often as necessary.

An assertive person, able to communicate clearly and directly, but adequately.

The Data Engineer we are currently looking for is someone who:




Has technical knowledge in Databases (SQL and NO SQL), ETL Processes & BI Reporting.
Is an expert in Data Modelling & Data Architecture for Informational platforms.
Has good analytical skills, with proven domain experience in data warehousing, data lakes, and data virtualization within Bank and Finance Industry.
Has working experience in Agile environments.
Has clear communications skills as well as a high English level (written and oral).
Is able to work without instructions and to take initiative.
Makes things happen thanks to his/her ‚Äòcan do‚Äô attitude.
Has a problem solving mindset.
Is a team player (daily connection with other departments is expected)
Has the ability to work on an international level.
Takes the initiative for improving processes, ensuring creative ideas are implemented.
Is a leader of our Orange Code culture, displaying a positive attitude, commitment towards our goals, accountable, eager to learn and is not afraid of change.




Considering the software you may use as a Data Software Engineer, specific experience would be desirable for the following:

Experience within Data Lake and Big Data environments
BigQuery
Oracle (19c)
Data virtualization or denodo tool
IBM DataStage & IBM IGC
IBM Cognos, Power BI and/or MicroStrategy or similar BI tools
Azure Devops or other devops cloud service
Has knowledge & experience in cloud environments.
Security, monitoring and logging skills (e.g. ELK, Prometheus, Grafana)
Ability to create automation tools (e.g. Python/Go, DBT)
Has knowledge of Elastic Cloud Storage (ECS)







What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but‚Ä¶ What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.




Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn‚Äôt take up your time or your cravings.




Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!




Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.




Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids‚Ä¶




Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.




Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!




More vitality and more belonging

360¬∫ care of the employee (physical, mental, social connection & purpose).

Physiotherapy service on site.

Runners club with your own trainer.

Clinics with professional, world-class athletes.

Gympass service.

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+) & Leonas.







Get to know Us




We are a team of more than 1600 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.




A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.




And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.




We are proud to have a diverse team and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.




And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clients decide to embark on this journey.




Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead‚Äîthat‚Äôs our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working‚Ä¶we are looking forward to meeting you!

¬øCu√°les ser√°n tus funciones y responsabilidades?


Realizaci√≥n de visitas informativas puerta a puerta a establecimientos comerciales generadores de residuos org√°nicos sobre la campa√±a de implantaci√≥n del contenedor marr√≥n en Puente Genil. En cada establecimiento comercial se entregar√° material informativo de la campa√±a: carta y folleto.

Iniciativa
Autonom√≠a y responsabilidad
Digital

Significa formar parte de una empresa certificada B Corp‚Ñ¢ con m√°s de 40 a√±os de experiencia en sensibilizaci√≥n y educaci√≥n ambiental, comprometida con la sostenibilidad y la responsabilidad social.

La posibilidad de participar en diferentes campa√±as a lo largo del a√±o (en funci√≥n de tu disponibilidad), estableciendo conexiones profesionales con otros compa√±eros/as y expertos de Anthesis, mientras potencias tu aprendizaje y ampl√≠as tu visi√≥n y conocimientos del sector ambiental.

La oportunidad de contribuir a un sector estrat√©gico como la educaci√≥n ambiental, fundamental para promover la sostenibilidad.


En Anthesis valoramos la diversidad como motor de cambio y clave para formar equipos √∫nicos, inclusivos y proactivos. Trabajamos para crear un entorno justo y diverso donde cada persona pueda desarrollar su potencial con respeto y reconocimiento.

Title: Expression of Interest - Join us at Xata!
Description:
Location: Remote from Europe or the United States (East Coast only).

At Xata, we're always on the lookout for talented individuals who are eager to join us on our mission to redefine what databases are capable of.

While we may not have a specific role that matches your expertise right now, we‚Äôre growing fast‚Äîand we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

By submitting an expression of interest, you‚Äôll:


Be among the first to hear about future opportunities that match your skills and interests.
Get a chance to showcase your passion for Xata and what you can bring to the team.
Build a connection with our team and stay on our radar for exciting roles.


Our mission:

At Xata we‚Äôre on a mission to radically simplify the way developers work with data with our Postgres database platform.

We make managing database infrastructure easy giving developers all the functionality their application needs to evolve at scale.

What we‚Äôre building at Xata:

Modern applications are complex. We are building a Postgres Database Platform that augments PostgreSQL with the functionality modern applications need at scale.

In every feature we build, we optimise for developer experience that will ultimately reduce our customers time to market or dramatically simplify hard architectural problems at scale. Our application is highly intuitive and is great for data collaboration with the entire team.

How to apply:

Tell us about yourself! Submit your resume, portfolio, GitHub repo or LinkedIn profile, along with a short note about what your ideal position is.

Working at Xata:


We‚Äôre stable. We raised $35M and have years of runway.
We're remote first and have more than 10 years of experience leading distributed teams at Elastic. Our team is distributed around the world, mainly in Europe and the east coast of the USA.
Be part of a healthy culture, a culture that truly thrives innovation, a culture that empowers people and cares about the team members
We work asynchronously. We don‚Äôt do agile, the team meets weekly to check-in and then we use Github, Notion and Slack.
You'll have autonomy, lead features or projects, and bring ideas to the table.
We are community-driven and deeply care about the success of our users and customers.
Our team is diverse with over 40% women.
Xata is female-founded and the first developer platform to have an all-female board of directors.
We incentivise Conference meet-ups


What we offer all of our employees:


Competitive salary and stock options.
Friendly, diverse and inclusive work environment.
30 vacation days (not including local public holidays).
2 months full paid parental leave.
Flexibility, autonomy and impact.
Home office set-up budget + co-working space stipend.
We support continuous learning with budgets for conferences, courses and books.
Healthcare.
2 company offsites per year, with partners and kids welcome as well. So far we‚Äôve been to Italy, Greece, Spain and Portugal. Join our next one in Iceland!
Ample opportunity and support for career development and impact, there are no boundaries to your growth here at Xata.


Our investors:

Xata is well-financed by amazing investors, including Guillermo Rauch (founder of Vercel), Shay Banon (co-founder and CEO of Elastic), Neha Narkhede (founder of Confluent), Elad Gil, Christian Bach, and Mathias Biilmann (founders of Netlify), and many others.

We raised a $30 million Series A from top investors (Index Ventures and Redpoint), having the first ever 100% female board for such a technical company..

We care about diversity in tech:

If you come from an underrepresented background in tech, we strongly encourage you to apply. We strongly believe that our success is driven by the talented and diverse team brought together from a variety of backgrounds, cultures and countries. We are always challenging ourselves to build an inclusive culture that allows us to build innovative and successful products.

Our founder, Monica Sarbu, has also founded a non-profit organisation called Tupu that helps tech companies support diversity in tech through mentorship.

We're eager to hear from you and if you decide to apply, we're rooting for you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Powerdot started with the vision that charging your car should be as easy as charging your smartphone. And so for that to happen, chargers need to be available where people naturally spend their days.

Our mission? is as simple as ambitious - Accelerate Sustainable Mobility by investing in, installing, and operating EV chargers with a cutting-edge business model. We help businesses find the right charging solutions for their customers. Today, we‚Äôve partnered with over 1,200 businesses across Portugal, Spain, France, Belgium, Luxembourg, and Poland, with more than 2,200 contracted locations.

Who are we? ü§ù Firstly, we are Partner Obsessed creating bespoke solutions to better serve our partners‚Äô customers. üí° Secondly, we love the challenge of making EV charging simpler, readily available, and integrated with diverse retail and service experiences. üìà Finally, we are all about growing, expanding our network, our partners‚Äô businesses, and the professional development of our team, all while driving the EV ecosystem forward.

Who are you? We seek empowered top performers who share our mission and values, and who are ready to think disruptively and join our exciting journey. üöÄ

The Data Analyst role will be part of the Central Data team at Powerdot and will play a key role in the current phase of accelerated growth of the company. Moreover, the Data Analyst will be responsible for developing insights, analysis and eye-candy visualizations that support business decision making. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences.

Responsibilities


Gather and transform data from a variety of sources, including internal databases, external APIs, and surveys.
Analyze data using statistical techniques to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Develop data visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise way.
Work with stakeholders to understand their needs and develop data-driven solutions.
Maintain and support a culture of strong data quality
Stay up-to-date on the latest data analytics trends.
Mentor co-workers on analytics best practices.


The Candidate We Are Looking For


Up to 4 years of experience in data analytics
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Familiarity with SQL, Python and a data visualization tool such as Tableau, Metabase or Power B
Eagerness to learn and develop in a fast moving environment
Great communication skills
Easiness navigating in ambiguity and complexity
Ability to work independently and as part of a team


Get to know our benefits!


üè• Private health insurance coverage
üí™ Gym membership to help you stay active
‚è∞ Flexible working hours ‚Äî you own your time
üåç 4-day annual offsite where we celebrate the year‚Äôs achievements and spend quality time together (last year we went to Algarve, Portugal!)
ü§ù Regular team-building events with your local teammates
üç© Free office snacks and unlimited coffee
‚ö° Special discounts for charging your electric vehicle


Last but not least, at Powerdot we strongly believe that the best solutions and the most innovative ideas come from the coexistence of people with different backgrounds that reflect the diverse world we live in. We seek for a culture of diversity and inclusion - a culture where equal opportunities and mutual respect prevail and where everyone has the opportunity to speak up, challenge the status quo and make the difference.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
At Bloq.it, we‚Äôve created the world‚Äôs leading smart locker solution. Solving online deliveries by enabling everyone to participate easily, reducing delivery costs and making them more sustainable.

We‚Äôre quickly expanding, and after growing at 1000% for three years in a row, we‚Äôre now the fastest-growing Smart Locker company in the world and one of the fastest growing scale-ups in Europe.

We are in search of a Data Analyst to join our innovative team as our new #bloqstar. In this role, you'll play a crucial role in designing and maintaining dashboards, responding to ad-hoc data requests, and collaborating with colleagues to continually elevate Bloq.it‚Äôs support processes.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

  • Build real-time and periodic reporting tools to track ticket volumes, SLA adherence, and operational KPIs;
  • Investigate spikes in issues, unusual trends, or client-specific concerns and produce clear, concise findings;
  • Collaborate with the Tooling Specialist to ensure accurate data flow from various systems;
  • Present actionable recommendations to the Intelligence Team Lead and other stakeholders;
  • Prepare periodic business review reports and performance summaries for customers, highlighting key insights and recommendations.

What You‚Äôll Bring To The Table

  • Experience with BI platforms (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker) and data manipulation (SQL, Python, etc.);
  • Ability to dissect complex data sets and identify root causes behind trends;
  • Capable of explaining technical findings to both technical and non-technical audiences;
  • Comfortable working cross-functionally with support managers, tool specialists, and engineering teams;
  • Fluency in English and Portuguese (written and spoken).

Why join us?

The opportunity to join our Operations team and play a pivotal role in analyzing and optimizing support data to enhance efficiency, improve processes, and drive strategic decision-making while contributing to innovative solutions that redefine Bloq.it's revolution in the smart locker industry ;

A dynamic and fast-paced work environment with a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning ;

Competitive salary and flexible benefits package, tailored to your experience and skills ;

Eligibility for performance-based bonus, tied to your results and designed to reward your impact ;

Work how you work best - we offer a remote-friendly policy and flexible hours so you can stay productive and keep life balanced ;

Portuguese Health Insurance ;

Unlimited days off (subject to manager approval).

Ready to join the revolution?

At Bloq.it, we provide end-to-end solutions for Smart Lockers, and our software ecosystem, Bloq.it OS, is the leading tech solution available in the market.

We've had the pleasure of working with some of the biggest names in e-commerce, logistics, and retail in Europe, such as Vinted and DHL.

We have recently become the fastest-growing Smart Locker company in the world. Before Bloq.it the industry had stagnated and lacked innovation and good products. We strive to have the same impact in this industry as Tesla has had on the car industry.

We believe that Smart Lockers are a big part of the future for everyone, and we want to play our part in making sure that Smart Lockers become as mainstream as the mobile phone.

Title: Junior Power BI Consultant
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good.

Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.

Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

We are looking for a Consultant for the Power BI solution, who will also act as the guarantor of Modern BI and Data Visualization best practices. This role is key to ensuring the technical excellence and strategic evolution of our BI ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities


Act as the go-to expert for Power BI, ensuring adherence to best practices in data visualization and modern BI.
Administer Power BI Services, including workspace organization, access rights, role and authorization management, and data encryption.
Optimize performance through data compression, partitioning, and aggregation strategies.
Design and maintain advanced data models and ensure alignment with broader data architecture.
Collaborate with business and technical stakeholders to understand needs and translate them into effective BI solutions.
Drive continuous improvement through bug fixes, enhancements, and technical quality assurance.


Qualifications


Experience with Power BI implementation.
Strong proficiency in DAX, SQL, and M (Power Query).
Deep understanding of data modeling and data architecture.
Experience with performance optimization techniques in Power BI.
Expertise in data visualization principles and storytelling with data.


Soft Skills


Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Comfortable interacting with both business and technical stakeholders.
Curious, proactive, and eager to stay up to date with BI trends and technologies.


Nice to Have


PL-300: Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst certification.
Experience with Google BigQuery.
Knowledge of Python and ETL tools.
Familiarity with Oracle Database and MongoDB.


Passionate about data, stunning visualizations, and cutting-edge tech? Join us and lead the way in transforming BI with Power BI!"

Passionate about data, stunning visualizations, and cutting-edge tech? Join us and lead the way in transforming BI with Power BI!"

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Transaction Banking business concerns two fundamental business lines:
Cash Management: all products that assist our customers with their liquidity needs (current accounts, term deposits, payments & collections, forex)
Global Trade Solutions: all products that assist our customers with their global trade needs (letters of credit, guarantees, supply chain management, factoring)
The Business Intelligence Data Analyst‚Äôs main mission is to provide global support to the Multinational Corporates (MNCs) and Non-Banking Financial Institutions (NBFIs) fili√®re on all data related topics and contribute to the automation and industrialization of Transaction Banking (TB) Reporting.

Your Main Activities Are


Automate TB business dashboards as prototypes and prepare them to be put in production, working closely with the team¬¥s data analysts
Conduct ad-hoc analysis on MNCs and NBFIs and present findings to senior management and other stakeholders
Collect, clean and analyze large data sets from various sources to identify trends, patterns and insights
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing data quality checks and validation processes
Identify opportunities for process improvements and recommend data-driven solutions


Profile And Skills To Success


Master‚Äôs degree in Mathematics and Statistics or Information Technology and Computer Science
Excellent communication skills and fluency in English, both oral and written
At least 2 years of experience in Data Analytics
Proficiency in Microsoft SQL server, Tableau or Power BI
Results driven mindset with an ability approach and the ability to synthetize


About The Team


The Global TB COO team assists the different business teams in multiple topics, both on daily and monthly needs, as in project mode, where the data analysts and scientists focus on data involved in the conception of data use cases from exploration phase up to production delivery


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Product Data Analyst Trainee | Digital Channels
Description:
Country: Portugal

Location: Lisbon (Hybrid)

About Santander

Santander Bank is a leading global financial institution, dedicated to helping individuals

and businesses prosper. With a presence in over 10 countries, we provide a full range of

banking services, including personal, business, and corporate banking. At Santander,

we‚Äôre committed to innovation and continuously improving our digital offerings to meet

the evolving needs of our customers. Our fintech-driven approach emphasizes

leveraging cutting-edge technology to deliver seamless, secure, and personalized

financial experiences.

About The Role

We are looking for a data-driven Product Data Analyst Trainee to join our Digital

Channels team. This role focuses on leveraging data to inform and optimize product

decisions, ensuring our web and app platforms deliver outstanding customer

experiences. The ideal candidate will have basic knowledge of Google Analytics 4 (GA4)

and an analytical background, helping the team with product discovery, business case

development, A/B testing, and the continuous monitoring of key features through

dashboards and reporting tools.

Main Responsibilities


User interaction Analysis: Support in analyzing web and app usage data to uncover


trends, user behavior, and opportunities for product improvement.


Product Discovery Support: Collaborate with Product Managers during the


discovery phase by providing insights from data to identify customer needs and validate

opportunities.


Business Case Development: Contribute to the development of business cases by


providing data-driven insights and projections to evaluate potential product initiatives.


Success Metrics Definition: Partner with stakeholders to define and track key


success metrics for new features and initiatives. Map and define tracking events for key

product metrics (GA4 tagging).


A/B Testing: Design, execute, and analyze A/B tests to validate hypotheses, measure


impact, and optimize product performance.


Dashboard Creation: Help to develop and maintain dashboards for continuous


monitoring of key features, ensuring stakeholders have real-time insights into

performance.


Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Product Managers, Engineers,


Designers, and Marketing teams to ensure data-driven decision-making throughout the

product lifecycle.


GA4 Optimization: Help to ensure best practices are followed on GA4 to maintain


consistency between different conversion funnels

Profile Needed


Experience: Demonstrate interest in data analytics and digital products.
Analytics Expertise: Basic understanding of Google Analytics (GA4 key features), and


of other analytics tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker Studio, Power BI).


Data Storytelling: Ability to transform complex data into clear, actionable insights


and present findings effectively to stakeholders.


Problem-Solving: Strong analytical mindset with a focus on solving complex


problems using data.


A/B Testing: Experience designing and interpreting A/B tests to evaluate product


hypotheses and feature performance.


Collaboration Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with


experience working in cross-functional teams.


Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering,


Mathematics), Economics, Marketing, Business or a related discipline.


Technical Skills: Familiarity with SQL, Python or R for data analysis is a plus. A basic


knowledge or interest of how websites and apps are built (e.g. HTML, CSS, JS) is also valued.

If you‚Äôre passionate about data, user behavior, digital products, and making a

meaningful impact in fintech, this is your opportunity to shine. Join Santander‚Äôs Digital

Channels team as a Product Data Analyst and help us shape the future of banking with data-driven insights!

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Location

Hybrid in Lisbon (minimum of 2-3 days a week from the office)

SHAPE THE FUTURE OF PRIVACY WITH USERCENTRICS

Usercentrics is a global leader in data privacy and privacy-led marketing solutions. We believe there is no need for a trade-off between growth and privacy compliance. Our vision is to unlock the potential of data privacy to empower a thriving digital ecosystem. We work with companies to create a healthy balance between data-driven business and privacy-led marketing for every size of enterprise. Our customers build trust with their users through improved transparency and control to drastically improve marketing and monetization, while achieving full privacy compliance.

We‚Äôre looking for a Product Data Analyst who thrives at the intersection of data, product

strategy, and business impact. In this role, you‚Äôll act as a bridge between data and product

teams , helping drive better decision-making through insight, instrumentation, and strong

stakeholder collaboration.

Your Tasks


Partner with Product Managers, Designers, and Engineers to identify key metrics and turn product data into actionable insights
Act as the PM for data-related initiatives that support the product organization(dashboards, tracking plans, user behavior models, etc.)
Own the instrumentation strategy for product features, ensuring accurate and scalable tracking using tools like Amplitude
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand needs, prioritize requests, and translate them into data products and solutions
Build and maintain dashboards and reports (Power BI or similar) to support decision-making
Communicate complex findings in a clear, business-friendly way to non-technical stakeholders
Support experimentation frameworks and help define success metrics
Ensure data quality and consistency across platforms and teams


You Bring


Solid business acumen and a strong understanding of product development lifecycle
Hands-on experience with product analytics tools (Amplitude required, Mixpanel or similar a plus)
Intermediate SQL skills, able to write clean, optimized queries
Experience with Power BI or similar BI tools (Looker, Tableau, etc.)
Excellent communication skills, you can explain data to non-data people with clarity and confidence
A proactive, collaborative mindset, you're comfortable prioritizing, managing stakeholders, and acting as the ‚Äúgo-to‚Äù person for product data
Experience working closely with Product, Design, or Engineering teams


NICE TO HAVE


Familiarity with event tracking plans, instrumentation workflows, or CDPs
Experience working in SaaS, B2B, or product-led growth environments
Exposure to A/B testing, growth analytics, or behavioral segmentation


Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of colour are

less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Usercentrics we are

dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you‚Äôre excited about this

role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job

description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or

other roles.

Why join Usercentrics?


Joining Usercentrics means becoming part of a fast-growing, diverse and international team of tech enthusiasts and entrepreneurially-minded who build our success story together
Company culture is important to us - we strive to continuously develop a positive, vibrant and inspiring environment that enables everyone to thrive both personally and professionally
Get involved! We have plenty of initiatives and love to see people from all department enthusiastically participating and shaping our future together in different cross-department projects
Your work-life balance is important to us too - we offer flexible working hours, hybrid working and the possibility of workcations (in accordance with our company policy)
We always remember to have fun along the way, both in our day-to-day work and at our regular team events on site in our offices in Munich, Copenhagen, Odense, Lisbon and Prague or online
You are the most valuable asset to our company which is why we‚Äôre happy to offer awesome benefits like our personal development budget, job-related language courses and a lot more (depending on your location) to focus on your well being


About Us

We are driven by our values #BeBrave, #BetterTogether, #LeadbyExample, #InnovateWithPurpose, #PassionForPrivacy, #GiveBack and #ComeAsYouAre. They show what we believe in and how we work. They help make our team special and guide us in everything we do. They're the heart of our company and inspire us to do our best every day.

We strive to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment (DEI) where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential. We believe that our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are our greatest strengths ‚Äî so we are committed to building with them as we foster innovation and drive our success.

We recognize that this is an ongoing journey. We commit to listening and to continuous learning, growth, and improvement. By embracing DEI principles, we will create a more just and equitable society, and we are proud to play our part in making this vision a reality.

We are #BetterTogether.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
CAPGEMINI ENGINEERING

At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world‚Äôs most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.

YOUR ROLE

As a Data Analyst at PMI, you will play a key role in transforming data into actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making across the organization. You will work with tools such as SQL, Excel, Power BI, and Tableau to analyze trends, define key performance indicators (KPIs) like model bias and accuracy, and support data quality initiatives.

Key Responsibilities:


Support Data Privacy Impact Assessments (DPIA) and Business System Owner (BSO) approvals.
Define and maintain business terms using Atlan for metadata management.
Design and implement data quality checks within DSH.
Reconcile source data with historical records using DPaaS.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data integrity and alignment with business goals.
Present findings and insights in a clear, concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


YOUR PROFILE


Proven experience with SQL and Business Intelligence tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Strong proficiency in Excel and data visualization techniques.
Familiarity with data quality and metadata management tools such as Atlan, Snowflake, and DSH is a plus.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
A proactive approach to problem-solving and continuous improvement.


What You‚Äôll Love About Working Here


Join a multicultural and inclusive team environment.
Enjoy a supportive atmosphere promoting work-life balance.
Hybrid work.
Your career growth is central to our mission. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professionals are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
Access valuable training and certifications in cutting-edge technologies.
Engage in exciting national and international projects.
Health and life insurance.
Referral program with bonuses for talent recommendations.
Great office locations.


Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you‚Äôd like, where you‚Äôll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you‚Äôll be able to reimagine what‚Äôs possible. Join us and help the world‚Äôs leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.

Title: Power BI Consultant
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good.

Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.

Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

We are looking for a Consultant for the Power BI solution, who will also act as the guarantor of Modern BI and Data Visualization best practices. This role is key to ensuring the technical excellence and strategic evolution of our BI ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities


Act as the go-to expert for Power BI, ensuring adherence to best practices in data visualization and modern BI.
Administer Power BI Services, including workspace organization, access rights, role and authorization management, and data encryption.
Optimize performance through data compression, partitioning, and aggregation strategies.
Design and maintain advanced data models and ensure alignment with broader data architecture.
Collaborate with business and technical stakeholders to understand needs and translate them into effective BI solutions.
Drive continuous improvement through bug fixes, enhancements, and technical quality assurance.


Qualifications


2/3 years of hands-on experience with Power BI implementation.
Strong proficiency in DAX, SQL, and M (Power Query).
Deep understanding of data modeling and data architecture.
Experience with performance optimization techniques in Power BI.
Expertise in data visualization principles and storytelling with data.


Soft Skills


Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Comfortable interacting with both business and technical stakeholders.
Curious, proactive, and eager to stay up to date with BI trends and technologies.


Nice to Have

HTML:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum‚Äôs team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum‚Äôs solutions aim at contributing to its clients‚Äô performance and innovation as well as the common good.

Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.

Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Job Description

We are looking for a Consultant for the Power BI solution, who will also act as the guarantor of Modern BI and Data Visualization best practices. This role is key to ensuring the technical excellence and strategic evolution of our BI ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities

  • Act as the go-to expert for Power BI, ensuring adherence to best practices in data visualization and modern BI.
  • Administer Power BI Services, including workspace organization, access rights, role and authorization management, and data encryption.
  • Optimize performance through data compression, partitioning, and aggregation strategies.
  • Design and maintain advanced data models and ensure alignment with broader data architecture.
  • Collaborate with business and technical stakeholders to understand needs and translate them into effective BI solutions.
  • Drive continuous improvement through bug fixes, enhancements, and technical quality assurance.

Qualifications

  • 2/3 years of hands-on experience with Power BI implementation.
  • Strong proficiency in DAX, SQL, and M (Power Query).
  • Deep understanding of data modeling and data architecture.
  • Experience with performance optimization techniques in Power BI.
  • Expertise in data visualization principles and storytelling with data.

Soft Skills

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Comfortable interacting with both business and technical stakeholders.
  • Curious, proactive, and eager to stay up to date with BI trends and technologies.

Nice to Have

  • PL-300: Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst certification.
  • Experience with Google BigQuery.
  • Knowledge of Python and ETL tools.
  • Familiarity with Oracle Database and MongoDB.

Passionate about data, stunning visualizations, and cutting-edge tech? Join us and lead the way in transforming BI with Power BI!"

Title: Data Market Analyst ‚Äì Business Planning
Description:
Imagine a world with zero vehicle accidents, zero vehicle emissions, and wireless vehicle connectivity all around us. Every day, we move closer to making that world a reality. Aptiv‚Äôs passionate team of engineers and developers creates advanced safety systems, high-performance electrification solutions and data connectivity solutions so that automakers can bring advanced capabilities to more people around the globe. This is how we enable sustainable mobility and help to prevent accidents caused by human error.

Want to join us?

Your role:


Conduct internal planning data analysis, transform data into knowledge to provide input for decision, compare data with Market industry-level to support operational and strategic initiatives.
Monitor market share, competitive intelligence, product development trends and EDS portfolio to support market positioning reports.
Align data analysis with company‚Äôs strategic direction. Initiate and support market research and competitor analysis by developing automatization of different data sources.
Collaborate with external research and consulting firms to provide insights to internal functions and leadership.
Participate in customer studies and market environment analysis.
Maintain up-to-date understanding of the EMEA wiring harness market, including key drivers such as electrification, regulatory shifts, consumer behavior, and regional trends.
Contribute to general business planning tasks as needed and support Commercial Teams in regards current and future business.


Your Background


Graduate or Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field
Strong proficiency in SQL, Microsoft Excel, and Power BI.
Working knowledge of SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).
Excellent command of office applications, including PowerPoint and Excel.
Familiarity with Automotive product portfolios and market forecasting.
Experience in market research, data analysis, or a related function.
Fluent in English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Able to perform under pressure, work collaboratively, and meet deadlines.


Nice To Have Skills


Experience with VBA, Power Query, Power Pivot, or Power Automate.
Automotive supplier background or direct exposure to manufacturing and business planning in the automotive sector.


Why join us?


You can grow at Aptiv. Aptiv provides an inclusive work environment where all individuals can grow and develop, regardless of gender, ethnicity or beliefs.
You can have an impact. Safety is a core Aptiv value; we want a safer world for us and our children, one with: Zero fatalities, Zero injuries, Zero accidents.
You have support. We ensure you have the resources and support you need to take care of your family and your physical and mental health with a competitive health insurance package.

Aptiv is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Visualization Specialist
Description:
About The Job


We are seeking a talented Senior Data Visualization Expert to join the CIB Human Resources team. As a Senior Data Visualization Expert, you will play a crucial role in transforming complex HR data into clear and actionable insights through visually compelling representations. Your work will empower our HR teams to make data-driven decisions that drive the success of our organization


Your Main Activities Are


Data Visualization: Create visually appealing and interactive data visualizations, including charts, graphs, dashboards, and reports, using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms
Storytelling: Translate data findings into compelling narratives to convey insights effectively to HR and organizational stakeholders
Data Analysis: Analyse large volumes of HR data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement
Data Integration: Collaborate with the HR and IT teams to integrate and maintain data sources to ensure data accuracy and completeness. Play a key role in sprint planning and contribute in daily standup meetings to ensure on time delivery of new developments
Data Quality Assurance: Implement data validation and quality control procedures to ensure data accuracy and reliability
User Training: Train HR staff on interpreting and using visualized data for informed decision-making
Project Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support HR-related projects and initiative
Stay Current: Keep up-to-date with industry best practices and emerging data visualization tools and techniques
Provide end user support and follow up with IT teams on any production incidents/issues and ensure they are resolved in a timely manor


Profile And Skills To Success


Masters Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
At least 3 years of experience in data analysis and visualization, preferably in a Human Resources context
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Data driven mindset / exploratory data analysis
Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Ability to work collaboratively in a team and meet project deadlines
Flexibility: ability to work in a changing environment
Project management skills
Facilitate problem solving & collaboration


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

HTML:
About The Job

  • We are seeking a talented Senior Data Visualization Expert to join the CIB Human Resources team. As a Senior Data Visualization Expert, you will play a crucial role in transforming complex HR data into clear and actionable insights through visually compelling representations. Your work will empower our HR teams to make data-driven decisions that drive the success of our organization

Your Main Activities Are

  • Data Visualization: Create visually appealing and interactive data visualizations, including charts, graphs, dashboards, and reports, using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms
  • Storytelling: Translate data findings into compelling narratives to convey insights effectively to HR and organizational stakeholders
  • Data Analysis: Analyse large volumes of HR data to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement
  • Data Integration: Collaborate with the HR and IT teams to integrate and maintain data sources to ensure data accuracy and completeness. Play a key role in sprint planning and contribute in daily standup meetings to ensure on time delivery of new developments
  • Data Quality Assurance: Implement data validation and quality control procedures to ensure data accuracy and reliability
  • User Training: Train HR staff on interpreting and using visualized data for informed decision-making
  • Project Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support HR-related projects and initiative
  • Stay Current: Keep up-to-date with industry best practices and emerging data visualization tools and techniques
  • Provide end user support and follow up with IT teams on any production incidents/issues and ensure they are resolved in a timely manor

Profile And Skills To Success

  • Masters Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
  • At least 3 years of experience in data analysis and visualization, preferably in a Human Resources context
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Data driven mindset / exploratory data analysis
  • Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a team and meet project deadlines
  • Flexibility: ability to work in a changing environment
  • Project management skills
  • Facilitate problem solving & collaboration

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Description

Who is Defined.ai? Well, from a technical point of view, we leverage the power of a global crowd to provide some of the world‚Äôs biggest companies with the high-quality data they need to power their artificial intelligence. We‚Äôre instrumental to the progression and development of artificial intelligence and we couldn‚Äôt be prouder or more inspired to be involved in an industry that is changing the world.

From a personal point of view, we‚Äôre a group of big thinkers, high achievers and creative problem solvers. We bond over our shared love of software engineering, data science, and strong coffee. We like online gaming, running marathons, and team drinks. We celebrate authenticity and diversity and we‚Äôre invested in what we do. Our mission? World domination, obviously!

What will you do?

  • Design and implement scalable PySpark-based data pipelines to process (clean, validate, package and deliver) multimodal AI training datasets (e.g., text, audio, video, images, etc.);
  • Develop ETL pipelines to fuel the Operations areas with data for their analytical dashboards;
  • Set software engineering tools, platforms, and best practices while performing trade-off analysis to best match engineering, product, and project constraints and expectations;
  • Operate data pipelines to ingest data from multiple sources, and deliver it to different destinations.
  • Help the Product Manager and stakeholders in structuring, breaking down, and prioritizing the product roadmap into backlog work items;
  • Collaborate with other software engineering teams such as SREs and DevOps to achieve your team‚Äôs goals;
  • Work together with Software Engineering teams so as to integrate the Data Platform with other tools and platforms.

Who are we looking for?

Do you have the drive to work in an innovative and ambitious environment?

We‚Äôre looking for someone with a determined and proactive mindset, someone inspired and passionate to help us achieve our goals. Our successful candidate is a strong critical thinker, reliable and transparent, with an ability to learn and communicate. We are looking for someone special to contribute to our unique culture.

  • BSc or MSc in Computer Science or similar background;
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience;
  • Experience in PySpark-based data pipelines and software quality best practices;
  • Worked with Azure services such as Synapse Analytics (mainly PySpark Jobs, Pipelines, and Notebooks), ADLS, Power BI, DevOps, and SQL and NoSQL databases;
  • Solid understanding of data-related architectures, concepts, technologies, and processes (e.g., Medallion, Data Lake, Data Lakehouse, Data Warehouse, ETL, etc.);
  • Comfortable with evaluating and applying software design and architectural patterns/principles;
  • Knowledge of RESTful APIs based on FastAPI, from the provider as well as the consumer point of view;
  • Problem Solving skills;
  • Proficient in both written and spoken English.

Benefits

You spend a lot of your time at work, so it should be challenging, fun and interesting. At Defined.ai it will be all of those things and more. Here‚Äôs what we offer:

  • Flexible working schedule and hybrid model. We know comfort can boost creativity and performance, so you can manage your schedule and work both from one of our modern office spaces or home.
  • Excellent career development opportunities in a high growth company. With us, you can accomplish your career goals and follow a well-described career path with the support of your supervisor.
  • Culture of feedback and continuous improvement. AI is a fast-paced area, so we keep track of tech trends, and we always ask for feedback.
  • An international and diverse team. We have more than 30 nationalities at our 3 locations, and we provide language classes.
  • Continuous training opportunities. You can choose from many options: leveraging hand-on workshops, unlimited access to Udemy and formal development opportunities.
  • We love to have fun together. We joke a lot, and we can't imagine work without fun activities ‚Äì we already surfed, raced carts and played soccer together.

About Us

Defined.ai offers a platform with multiple data delivery options that leverages machine learning technology and human intelligence to deliver quality-guaranteed training data for AI systems. The platform offers self-service and fully customizable solutions that deliver high-quality project-specific training data, enabling AI products reach market quicker. It is this business model that has allowed Defined.ai to raise a total of $63.6M in funding over 4 rounds. Our value proposition is quality, privacy, speed and scale, covering more than 50 different languages. With strong expertise in speech and natural language processing technologies, we have been serving AI companies and Fortune 500 companies since day one. Defined.ai was founded in Seattle and has offices in Lisbon and Porto.

Title: Traded Risk Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The mission of RISK Market & Financial Institutions (‚ÄúRISK MFI‚Äù) is to provide the Senior Management of the Group, of the RISK Function and of Global Markets (‚ÄúGM‚Äù) and of Securities and Services with full transparency and dynamic analysis and monitoring of market, counterparty, valuation and liquidity risks originated and managed by CIB and of credit risks on Financial Institutions in order to assist them in their risk decision making and monitoring
The Digital team within RISK MFI review processes and develops light IT solutions to automate the many risk management processes and analysis dashboards of the RISK MFI department
Each project is undertaken in a predefined environment and within specific guidelines built in coordination with the RISK IT department
There is a strong focus in improving the user experience and exploiting efficiently and timely the vast amount of available data
An understanding of the risk management purpose behind those processes is therefore key
Past projects have focused on automation of processes in Python, app development with interactive visualisations, BOT development, APIs, etc
The role encompasses the maintenance and support of existing tools, taking the lead on new developments, the close collaboration with the risk managers to shape an efficient visualisation of the data and related workflow of decisions
The Digital team works in close collaboration with the RISK IT department, making sure best coding practices are followed. It allows for a smooth the path to production of the tools developed by the team. For many projects, the Digital team directly codes in the official production systems under the guidance of RISK IT colleagues
The team uses a variety of technologies but specialises in Python, with some exposure to HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc
The team is based in London, Lisbon and Porto and operates following Agile principles . The team works alongside around 500 people focusing on Market, Counterparty and Liquidity risk topics


Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders


Profile and Skills to Success


Master‚Äôs Degree in Finance / Mathematics / Science / Engineering or related
At least 2 years of experience in a relevant data analysis field
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in Python
Attention to detail / rigor
Ability to synthetise / simplify
Analytical ability
Client focused
Organisational skills
Proactivity


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: Mid (3-5 years)

Type of position: Remote in Portugal. The candidates must be in Portugal.

The amazing you, will have:


Bachelor / Master in Computer Engineering or similar;
3-4 years of professional experience in data engineering roles;
Strong SQL skills and experience with relational databases;
Experience with data processing frameworks (Apache Spark, Databricks, or similar);
Proficiency in Python and familiarity with data processing libraries;
Knowledge of ETL design patterns and best practices;
Understanding of data modeling concepts and techniques;
Experience with version control systems (Git);
Experience with Azure data services (Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse, Azure);
Good level of english;
The candidate has to be in Portugal.




Why should you become part of our family?


You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!


Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.

All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.

All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

Title: Real Assets Data Analyst & Dev Power BI
Description:
About The Job


You will work in agile mode on different types of reporting for Real Assets, as a Data Analyst & BI Developer


Your Main Activities Are


Understanding business needs
Proposing technical and design solutions for reporting
Developing reports that are tailored to needs and performance-optimized
Contributing to the implementation of development best practices for the reporting team
Ensuring that developments do not negatively impact existing functionalities, particularly in terms of functional non-regression and performance
Writing documentation and technical specifications
Participating in cross-functional projects related to data analysis
Ensuring that the data displayed is accurate


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelor or Master degree Engineering or similar
Up to 3 years of relevant professional experience
Fluency in English both oral and written (mandatory)
Strong technical background in BI and SQL
Problem-solving mindset and initiative will be key assets for success in this role
Detail oriented with interest in data


About The Team


The Real Assets team includes a Coverage Relationship & Origination team, a Transaction & Execution team and a Credit Portfolio Management Team (CPM) spread across several countries serving the sector client in EMEA. These teams are split across Shipping & Offshore, Aviation, Rail, Real Estate, Export, Leasing & Alternative Structuring. This transversality aims to provide a common training path, opportunities to explore other sectors, more efficiency and greater mobility.
We are recruiting a Data Analyst & Dev Power BI to be part of the CPM Real Assets team focusing on Transportation, Export, ERI and Real Estate sectors. You will work in very close collaboration with the CIB ‚Äì ITO ‚Äì Transversal Reporting & Dashboarding Teams to develop reports ensure that the report built meet the user expectations in terms of visuals, functionality, and ‚Äì most importantly ‚Äì data quality


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.
