Title: Associate, Data Steward (Remote)
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for SMBC. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Join our mission to create a completely new, 100% digital bank that uses consumer feedback to truly meet customers‚Äô best interests. Jenius Bank, a division of SMBC MANUBANK, and a member of SMBC Group, is being built by a close-knit and fun-loving team of financial services professionals and technology experts who came together for the challenge of building a full-service digital bank from scratch. We‚Äôre committed to doing it the right way for the customer and are growing rapidly. To learn more about our relationship to our parent company, visit our website.

The anticipated salary range for this role is between $103,000.00 and $158,000.00. The specific salary offered to an applicant will be based on their individual qualification, experiences, and analysis of current compensation paid in their geography and the market for similar roles at time of hire. The role may also be eligible for an annual discretionary incentive award. In addition to cash compensation, SMBC MANUBANK offers a competitive portfolio of benefits to its employees.

Jenius Bank is strategically scaling up a portfolio of products and building extraordinary experiences. In 2023, we launched our first two products reaching $1 billion in deposits and over $700 million in loans, all before Jenius Bank‚Äôs first anniversary. We don‚Äôt plan to slow down, with ambitious growth plans and the capital necessary to execute a multi-year strategic plan. We have a start-up mindset paired with SMBC Group‚Äôs 400 years of history.

SMBC Group has more than 150 offices and 86,000 employees worldwide in nearly 40 countries and is committed to creating new business to better serve customers in the rapidly evolving digital environment. Join us on the journey that has caught the attention of the Banking Dive, and more to reinvent banking where smarter banking translates to a richer life.

Summary

This role serves as a critical liaison between business units, IT, and compliance functions to ensure data is governed effectively across the enterprise. This role is responsible for advising on and enforcing data standards and practices, validating data quality, and supporting the development of structures and procedures that ensure the accurate, secure, and efficient use of corporate data assets.

Principal Duties And Responsibilities


Provide guidance to business unit leaders on the implementation and enforcement of data governance policies and standards.
Develop and maintain authoritative documentation, including data dictionaries, relational data models, and lineage maps to ensure consistent data definitions and relationships across systems.
Approve structural changes to data assets, ensuring alignment with enterprise standards and governance requirements.
Audit data sources to validate accuracy, completeness, and compliance with defined quality standards.
Analyze reporting on data quality and policy compliance to recommend enhancements to governance procedures.
Design and oversee data storage architectures with a focus on minimizing redundancy and ensuring seamless integration across platforms.
Collaborate with compliance teams to assess data retention and access policies, ensuring alignment with regulatory and risk management requirements.
Work in partnership with IT and database administrators to design and maintain secure, scalable, and compliant data structures.
Coordinate with business stakeholders to formalize data input protocols and usage guidelines that promote data integrity and accountability.
Lead or support training initiatives to promote awareness and adoption of data standards across teams.]
Engage with application development teams to implement tools and automation that reinforce data accuracy, standardization, and usability.
Exhibit in-depth knowledge of industry regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and leading practices in data governance.
Demonstrate advanced proficiency in enterprise data architecture, integration solutions, and quality assurance frameworks.
Maintain strong familiarity with key corporate data sources and operational processes to provide actionable recommendations on data strategy and policy.
Facilitate cross-functional data initiatives, ensuring alignment to enterprise data governance goals and consistent adherence to standards.


Position Specifications


Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in data governance, data stewardship, or a related technical data management role.
Expertise in data architecture, metadata management, master data management, and data quality tools.
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to translate complex data issues into clear action plans.
Experience working in hybrid data environments (e.g., cloud-based and on-premise systems).
Proven ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams including IT, compliance, and business stakeholders.


EOE STATEMENT

SMBC provides reasonable accommodations during candidacy for applicants with disabilities consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application process, please let us know at accommodations@smbcgroup.com.

CCPA DISCLOSURE

Personal Information Collection Notice: This notice contains information under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) about the categories of personal information (PI) of California residents that SMBC MANUBANK collects and the business or commercial purpose(s) for which the PI may be used. We do not sell PI. More information about our collection and use of PI may be found in our CCPA Privacy Policy at https://www.smbcmanubank.com/privacy/ccpa-disclosure . Persons with disabilities may contact our Customer Contact Center toll-free at (877) 560-9812 to request the information in this Notice in an alternative format.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

Crane Worldwide Logistics is a supply chain company that provides individual solutions to address its client's logistics challenges. The Data Analyst II will partner with executive and operational leadership to leverage data for problem-solving and decision-making, while also engaging with business stakeholders to enhance understanding of the company's operations.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Engage regularly with internal partners for business reviews and health checks.

‚Ä¢ Answer key questions for business leadership.

‚Ä¢ Use data and statistics to validate assumptions and analytic results.

‚Ä¢ Present findings and make actionable tools in the most appropriate form (whether as a notebook, presentation, dashboard, or application)

‚Ä¢ Focus on speed to insight.

‚Ä¢ Inform long-term development priorities by partnering closely with the Business Intelligence team: metrics, data quality, and reusable data sets.

‚Ä¢ Advise embedded analysts and self-service data consumers in your domain.

‚Ä¢ Analyze key aspects of the operational and business lifecycle to create actionable recommendations.

‚Ä¢ Generate forecasts to drive decisions and identify anomalies.

‚Ä¢ Other duties as assigned.




Qualifications:




Required:

‚Ä¢ Fluent SQL

‚Ä¢ Comfortable programming in R, Python, or Julia

‚Ä¢ Fundamentals of statistics

‚Ä¢ Prior experience making or publishing analytical web apps (e.g. Shiny, Streamlit)

‚Ä¢ Comfortable with common BI tools

‚Ä¢ Comfortable using common ML approaches to solve analytical problems.

‚Ä¢ 2+ years in data analysis roles

‚Ä¢ Job requires the ability to use vision, adjust focus and work on a standard computer screen.

‚Ä¢ Job may require extended sitting or standing, use of standard office equipment.

‚Ä¢ Job will require presence on-site at the assigned work location.




Preferred:

‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in management information systems, Computer Science, or related field of study




Company:

Crane Worldwide Logistics is a supply chain company that provides individual solutions to address its client's logistics challenges. Founded in 2008, the company is headquartered in Houston, Texas, USA, with a team of 1001-5000 employees. The company is currently Late Stage. Crane Worldwide Logistics has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

There are over 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we're all about at John Deere. And it's why we're investing in our people and our technology like never before! Here the world's brightest minds are tackling the world's biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we'll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.

Primary Location: United States (US) - Iowa - Remote

Function: Data and Analytics (CA)

Title: Part-Time Student - Data and Analytics - Remote - 113493

Onsite/Remote: Remote Position

Note: Relocation assistance is not provided.

The Part-Time Student Program is primarily designed to augment the Company's regular full-time staff and is for students who work in parallel to their school schedule YEAR-ROUND .

Your Responsibilities

As a Part-Time Student - Data Analytics for John Deere Waterloo Works working remotely, you will...

  • Maintain and develop new tools and process for efficiency improvements
  • Leverage coding platforms, including AI and Machine Learning to improve operational efficiency and customer satisfaction
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to solve business and technical needs.

VISA Sponsorship is NOT available for this position.

What Skills You Need

  • Demonstrated ability to rapidly learn new technologies.
  • Experience in at least one programming language (Python, SQL, etc)
  • Strong analytical, communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills
  • Pursuing a degree in IT, Computer Science, Data Science, Computer Engineering, or a related STEM field.
  • Must be registered as a full-time student at an accredited university
  • Graduation date of 2026 or later
  • Cumulative GPA of 2.8 or above
  • 16-20 hours/week during academic year
  • 35-40 hours/week during summer semester

What Makes You Stand Out

  • Experience with Data Warehouse and Data Lake technologies, including Big Data tools like Databricks, Spark, React
  • Proficiency in BI reporting tools like Tableau or Power BI

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
*Responsibilities*

This role will focus on data management and analytics responsibilities for quality, research, and academic efforts. The incumbent will exercise strong IT business judgement, data quality and integrity management skills, and effective leadership skills across the division to identify, measure, and drive positive outcomes for our Data and Analytics projects. This position will support the effort to achieve data analysis and reporting objectives across the organization.

*Qualifications*

*MINIMUM*

Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent professional experience (5 years) in lieu of the degree

2+ years of experience in data and/or statistical analysis or related field

*PREFERRED*

Master's degree

3+ years of experience in data and/or statistical analysis

*Overview*

Hello humankindness Located conveniently in the heart of Phoenix, Arizona,St. Joseph's Hospital and Medical Center is a 571-bed, not-for-profit hospital that provides a wide range of health, social and support services. Founded in 1895 by the Sisters of Mercy, St. Joseph's was the first hospital in the Phoenix area. More than 125 years later, St. Joseph's remains dedicated to its mission of caring for the poor and underserved. We are extremely proud to be a nationally recognized center for quality quaternary care, medical education and research. St. Joseph's includes the internationally renowned Barrow Neurological Institute, Norton Thoracic Institute, Cancer Center at St. Joseph's, Ivy Brain Tumor Center, and St. Joseph's Level I Trauma Center (which is verified by the American College of Surgeons). The hospital is also a respected center for high-risk obstetrics, neuro-rehabilitation, orthopedics, and other medical services. St. Joseph‚Äôs is considered a sought-after destination hospital for treating the most complex cases from throughout the world. Every day, approximately 20 percent of the hospital‚Äôs patients have traveled from outside of Arizona and the United States to seek treatment at St. Joseph‚Äôs. U.S News & World Report routinely ranks St. Joseph's among the top hospitals in the United States for neurology and neurosurgery. In addition, St. Joseph's boasts the Creighton University School of Medicine at St. Joseph's, and a strategic alliance with Phoenix Children's Hospital. St. Joseph's is consistently named an outstanding place to work and one of Arizona's healthiest employers. Come grow your career with one of Arizona's Most Admired Companies. Look for us on Facebookand follow us on Twitter. For the health of our community ... we are proud to be a tobacco-free campus.

*Pay Range*

$30.55 - $44.30 /hour
